title: Senior Quantitative Researcher
description:
Balyasny Asset Management (BAM) is a global, multi-strategy investment Firm with over $21 billion in assets under management. We are a diversified business, with global breadth and depth. Our Firm has a clear mission: To consistently deliver uncorrelated returns in all market environments. Today, BAM employs more than 160 portfolio managers and 1,200 investment professionals across 19 offices in the U.S., Europe, the Middle East, and Asia. We are active across six investing strategies: Equities Long/Short, Equities Arbitrage, Macro, Commodities, Systematic, and Growth Equity. We also have a dedicated private investment team, BAM Elevate, and a standalone equities unit, Corbets Capital.

ROLE OVERVIEW

PM Engagement coaches equity Portfolio Managers with a specific focus on portfolio construction, provides analytics and insights into their portfolio and process, and helps them grow their business to be successful/ profitable at BAM. The team works with teams across fundamental long/ short equity, index arbitrage, and merger arbitrage strategies. The team is involved in research on topics including equity portfolio analytics, factor/ factor model research, and analysis of best practices in the portfolio construction/ investment process.

The Senior Quantitative Researcher, PM Engagement, is responsible for working with equity PMs on their portfolio construction and investment process, helping them understand their risk taking and improve their profitability and scalability. The researcher will be expected to contribute to the development of quantitative models for the analysis of portfolio risk & performance for strategies, including alternative equity strategies. Leveraging his or her excellent communications skills and deep understanding how investment process, portfolio construction and analytics impact outcomes, the researcher will be responsible for developing models, conducting analysis, and sharing insights on drivers of P&L, best practices, and portfolio construction concepts with portfolio managers and business management.

The successful candidate should be passionate about equity investing with experience in Long/Short or alternative equity strategies, and possess advanced quantitative abilities, strong analytical skills, and be a strong communicator able to explain quantitative concepts and recommendations to other investment professionals. They will demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and an ability generate and execute creative ideas as the team builds analytics and tools to support and grow the business.

In the role of Senior Quantitative Researcher, PM Engagement, the employee will be responsible for the following:
• Improving profitability and scalability of the equities business at BAM by working directly with PMs to drive performance and scale; supporting tailored analysis with quantitative research and a deep understanding of the investment process.
• Research: Develop models for analysis of investment process, portfolio construction, risk and return attribution for strategies
• Understand team investment processes and how to capture and analyze relevant data
• Develop analysis supported by data for individual teams and/ or using data across the business to provide analysis on best practices, insights, and areas to improve risk-adjusted returns
• Propose and substantiate new research ideas that can be delivered to Portfolio Managers/ Business
• Respond to analytical questions from portfolio managers and senior management related to risk, portfolio construction, investment process
• Relationships and Advising: Managing relationships with Portfolio Managers and work with them to grow and improve profitability of their business. Functioning as a representative of equity risk, interface with PMs. Ensure that views / themes are accurately represented within portfolios
• Encourage dialogue / communication around analytics and offensive risk taking as well as risk guidelines
• Communicate analysis and recommendations clearly through face-to-face meetings, presentations and written documentation with global PM teams focused on equity strategies, as well as business management
• Guide PMs on use of tools, concepts and leveraging resources/ analytics and insights to improve their process, portfolio construction/ hedging
• Project Ownership: Collaborate with other Quantitative Researchers across Risk & Development, Data, Product and Engineering teams on accessing data sets and developing tools that improve Portfolio Managers or Business efficiency, profitability, and understanding of portfolio/ risks
• Deliver complex projects with multiple stakeholders
• Provide feedback on tools and help provide specifications for new tools

Qualifications:

The candidate must be able to demonstrate expertise in quantitative analysis techniques including statistical analysis, experience working with market data and large data sets programmatically, and strong analytical skills.

Additionally, the candidate should have experience with financial data and equity investment strategies including risk, performance attribution, and investment process.

Key qualifications include:
• 5+ years of experience working on a team with experience understanding risk/ portfolio construction and analytics related to equity Long/ Short or other alternative equity strategies, including at least 2 years of direct interaction with risk takers or in a risk-taking role
• Strong programming skills for quantitative analysis
• Strong Python skills – including prior experience with time series analysis, managing data, and contributing to internal analysis libraries in Python
• Experience with SQL for managing and accessing data
• Proficiency with software development process and tools such as GitHub
• Excellent communication/ presentation skills, confidence, and ability to influence, coach, educate fundamental PMs
• Outstanding written and oral communication skills
• Interest in learning from other investment experts, using feedback to improve analysis and understanding of strategies
• Understanding of quantitative research & investing
• Superior quantitative skills demonstrated through an advanced degree (PhD or Masters) in sciences/ math/ quantitative discipline and/ or practical experience applying quantitative finance theory
• Experience implementing statistical models
• Understanding of factor models and their applications
• Attention to detail and passion/ grit for getting things done, digging into problems, and helping develop solutions
• Sense of ownership and entrepreneurialism to grow the business
• Passion for investing / economics / stock market = Desire to work with portfolio teams focused on equity strategies

title: Trading Strategist / PM - HK
description:
Portfolio Manager
Athena Capital Research is a global quantitative investment manager with offices in New York and Hong Kong. With strengths in technology and finance, we combine discipline and creativity to achieve success in the growing field of automated trading. The firm was formed in 2003 and our Hong Kong office in 2010. The Hong Kong office is Athena’s Asia headquarters and manages the firm’s highly successful Asia-focused strategies. We are looking for exceptional individuals to join our elite team.

Job description
Our hedge fund specializes in fully automated trading. We have developed a best-in-class automated trading platform, featuring direct market access to major financial exchanges, and a complete system for developing and automating trading strategies. We will provide the technology, the capital, detailed historical data, lowest cost commissions, and highest quality executions—you will leverage these tools to build profitable trading strategies. We’ve built the body, you build the brains.
This position will be directly responsible for generating profits for the company. A core part of our culture is to share profits with people who are responsible for them. Therefore, this position is potentially very lucrative. We will provide you with the resources needed; it will be up to you to develop and drive these strategies to maximum profitability.

Key Responsibilities
• Build and maintain quantitative trading models by researching and establishing investment strategies
• Oversee daily performance and evaluate against historical data
• Assess portfolio to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, firm policies and portfolio investment strategies
• Collaborate with Trade Ops to ensure stable deployment of quantitative strategies

Requirements
• 3+ years managing and developing strategies and managing portfolio risk
• M.S. or Ph.D. degree from a top-tier school in a technical, scientific, and/or quantitative field
• 2+ years of experience with a major object oriented programming language (C++ / Java / C# preferred)
• 2+ years of experience working with Unix-based systems
• Strong desire to conquer the challenge of outperforming other financial market participants
• Self-motivated, hardworking, creative and competitive personality
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Desired Skills
• Statistical modeling, time series, machine learning, big data, or other data modeling experience
• Matlab, R, Stata, numPy, Pandas: expertise with any of these is a plus

title: Senior Quant Risk Manager (Derivatives)
description:
My client, a leading financial institution, is expanding its Hong Kong team and seeking an experienced Quant with a solid derivatives background. Reporting the Head of Quant Risk you will be responsible for the following:

Responsibilities
• Work in close collaboration with risk management units on quant risk methodology projects and initiatives, liaising with model validation teams to identify issues in risk models and propose enhancements.
• Provide risk analysis and impact analysis and prepare relevant proposal papers for internal and regulatory approval.
• Review risk models to assess performance, and participate in testing and validation of risk systems while working with the Quant Development teams for risk monitoring process automation.
• Perform risk monitoring on margin levels, positions and risk exposures and carry out regular reviews on risk model parameters, providing guidelines to risk control teams accordingly.

Requirements:
• Masters/PhD degree in either Physics, Mathematics, Financial Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Statistics.
• At least 5 years of experience in financial markets, and hands-on experience in Derivatives Pricing and Risk modelling.
• Experience in large datasets, tick data, etc. and a solid proficiency in Python are all ideal. Knowledge of order management and market micro-structure is preferred
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and an outgoing, extroverted personality is essential.

title: Portfolio Manager
description:
About Rock Bund Capital

Founded in 2019, Rock Bund Capital is a proprietary trading firm dedicated to shaping the future of the cryptocurrency industry. We have an average daily trading volume exceeding $1 billion and peak daily trading volume reaching $5 billion. We process over 7 million transactions daily, trading more than 1,000 symbols across multiple CEx and DEx.

Our team combines expertise in traditional finance, quantitative research, and advanced engineering with a deep understanding of blockchain technology. This unique blend enables us to excel in trading across complex crypto markets, including both CeFi and DeFi, while providing capital and strategic guidance to projects that drive innovation and foster sustainable growth in the crypto industry.

Why Join Us

title: Asia Macro Strategist- Hedge Fund- London/ Hong Kong
description:
About the Role

We are working on behalf of a global, multi-strategy hedge fund seeking an experienced Macro Strategist with deep expertise in Asia, ideally including China and Japan, to join their macro research and trading team. This is a high-impact role that will support investment decision-making across global portfolios with regional insights, thematic views, and trade-relevant macro analysis.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop and maintain in-depth macroeconomic views across Asia, with a particular focus on China and Japan, including growth, inflation, fiscal/monetary policy, and geopolitical developments.
• Deliver clear, forward-looking research to inform top-down investment strategies across asset classes (rates, FX, equities, credit, commodities).
• Collaborate closely with Portfolio Managers, Traders, and Strategists globally to generate high-conviction trade ideas aligned with macro themes.
• Present thematic research, risk scenarios, and policy outlooks to internal investment teams.

Candidate Requirements
• 5+ years of experience in macroeconomic strategy or research, preferably within a hedge fund, global asset manager, or investment bank.
• Demonstrated expertise in Asian economies, particularly China and Japan; broader regional coverage is a plus.
• Proven ability to translate macroeconomic insights into actionable investment ideas.
• MSc or PhD in Economics or relevant discipline
• Some quantitative experience- econometrics/ quantitative modelling/ python
• Familiarity with data analysis tools (e.g., Bloomberg, Excel, Python, or R) to build or interpret macro models and dashboards.

If this role sounds interesting and in line with your background, please apply by sending your CV in WORD format to economics@octaviusfinance.com

title: Quantitative Researcher - Hong Kong
description:
The Role

The Quantitative Researcher will work directly with the portfolio manager, other quant researchers, and developers in a highly collaborative environment gaining exposure to all aspects of the investment process, including signal generation, portfolio construction and trade execution. You will leverage our top-notch research and trading infrastructure to develop and deploy models around alphas, execution, and risk management. The ideal candidate will be intellectually curious, love data and have a mindset of continuous improvement.

What You’ll Do

As a quantitative researcher, you will:
• Focus on research related to systematic macro trading strategies, mainly on rates/fixed-income assets.
• Contribute to building, maintenance, and continual improvement of production, trading, and execution.
• Evaluate new datasets for alpha potential, build analytics tools, improve existing signals and trading strategies.
• Collaborate with the portfolio manager directly, be a core contributor to the growing investment process.

What You’ll Bring

What you need:
• 3-7 years experience in systematic trading in rates/fixed-income derivatives, bonds or futures from top tier funds or banks.
• Demonstrate ability to conduct independent alpha research, portfolio construction, curve building and asset pricing.
• Masters or PhD degree in mathematics, computer science, economics or other related discipline.
• Experience with managing and running risk is a plus.

Our culture

The firm’s ethos is embedded in our people. ‘Talent is our strategy’ is our mantra and drives how we approach all initiatives at the firm. We believe our success is because of our people, so putting our talent above all else is our top priority.

Schonfeld strives to create an environment where our people can thrive. We foster a teamwork-oriented, collaborative environment where ideas at any level are encouraged and shared. The development and advancement of our talent is honed through interactions with each other, learning & educational offerings, and through opportunities to make impactful contributions. In our agile environment, engineers are expected to self-organize and collaborate on the best way to solve problems, and they are collectively responsible for the entire team's delivery. Engineering teams are small and cross-functional, and value learning and knowledge sharing.

At Schonfeld, we strive to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout all of our employees with Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at the forefront of this mission. As a firm we are committed to creating a hiring process which is not only fair, but also welcoming and supportive. On a daily basis, our employees welcome diversity across identity, thought, people and views which serves as the foundation of our culture and success. You can learn more about our DEI initiatives here - Belonging @ Schonfeld.

Who We Are

Schonfeld Strategic Advisors is a multi-manager platform that invests its capital with Internal and Partner portfolio managers, primarily on an exclusive or semi-exclusive basis, across four trading strategies; quantitative, fundamental equity, tactical trading and discretionary macro & fixed income. We have created a unique structure to provide global portfolio managers with autonomy, flexibility and support to best enable them to maximize the value of their businesses.

Over the last 30 years, Schonfeld has successfully capitalized on inefficiencies and opportunities within the markets. We have developed and invested heavily in proprietary technology, infrastructure and risk analytics and continue to capitalize on new opportunities. In 2021 we launched our newest strategy, discretionary macro & fixed income as part of the continual growth of Schonfeld’s investible universe. Our portfolio exposure has expanded across the Americas, Europe and Asia as well as multiple asset classes and products.

title: Associate Director, Portfolio Management
description:
Associate Director, Portfolio Management - Fund-of-Funds Investment

We believe in empowering every one of our people to find their 'better' - in the work they do, the career they build, the life they live and the difference they make. So that together we can support even more people - including our own - to live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.
About The Role

This role is responsible for managing fund-of-funds portfolios on AIAHK's MPF, ORSO and ILAS platforms to deliver outperformance for portfolios under management. Ensure portfolio compliance with relevant regulations and internal guidelines.
Key Responsibilities:

• Fund-of-funds Portfolio Management: Daily portfolio management across fund-of-funds portfolios on AIAHK's MPF, ORSO and ILAS platforms. Deliver outperformance against peer group median and benchmark. Ensure portfolios are in compliance with relevant regulations and internal guidelines.
• Funds Monitoring And Evaluation: Conduct quantitative and qualitative fund evaluation to identify and select well-performing funds for AIMHK managed multi-manager products to enhance investment performance and construct the portfolios for AIAHK's MPF, ORSO and ILAS products.

Job Requirements:
• Experience in managing public funds for reputable financial institutions.
• Satisfy Key Person requirement with at least 5 years of public funds management experience.
• Around 10 years of experience in investment experience and/or asset management.
• Postgraduate qualification in Finance, Economics or quantitative-related subjects.

title: Advanced Quantitative Portfolio Strategist

title: Quant Developer (Python/C++) – Global Hedge Fund – Hong Kong/Singapore
description:
Our client is one of the fastest growing global quantitative hedge funds who are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Python/C++ Quant Developer to join the Hong Kong/Singapore team. This role involves close collaboration with quant researchers, quant traders and portfolio managers, to build and enhance real-time analytics, pricing, and trading platforms. The ideal candidate is an experienced Python/C++ developer with a solid understanding of financial markets and a passion for building high-performance systems.

• Build scalable computational frameworks to support large-scale backtesting, simulation, and real-time analytics.
• Collaborate with quantitative researchers to translate complex mathematical models into efficient and production-ready code.
• Optimize performance of computational workflows and large-scale data pipelines.
• Integrate new data sources and APIs, and manage data ingestion processes.
• Ensure code quality through testing frameworks, documentation, and code review.
• Support production systems and troubleshoot critical issues in real time.
• Continuously evaluate and adopt modern technologies to enhance system capabilities.

Key Requirements
• 2+ years of professional development experience in Python OR C++ within financial industry.
• Experience working in a quantitative trading environment is highly preferred.
• Experience with SQL databases and data handling at scale will be a plus.
• Strong understanding of software engineering principles, data structures, and algorithms.
• Knowledge of financial instruments (e.g., equities, fixed income, derivatives).
• Excellent communication skills in fluent English, both written and verbal.

What We Offer
• Competitive compensation and performance-based bonuses.
• Opportunity to work with top-tier talent in a dynamic, intellectually rigorous environment.
• Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools.

title: Junior Front Office Developer | Hong Kong, HK | In-Office
description:
ActusRayPartners is a fast-growing emerging asset management company based in Hong Kong. Founded in 2019, the investment manager applies a Discretionary Probabilistic Investing process to alternative strategies. The investment process is built upon a quantitative framework on which the company overlays a discretionary strategy across hundreds of positions. We have a collaboration agreement with Sun Hung Kai & Co. Limited (SEHK:86), a listed financial services company. ActusRayPartners aims for the best in terms of consistent risk-adjusted performance, operations and client communications.

With the growth of the business and an array of opportunities ahead for a potential candidate, ActusRayPartners is looking for a Junior Front Office Developer to join the Research, Development and Implementation team. The team covers a wide range of roles and responsibilities ranging from quantitative research and data management to coding, development and support of IT infrastructure for the company as a whole.

Job Description:
• Develop and maintain front-office systems for portfolio management, stock analysis, and trading execution.
• Assist in the development of robust data infrastructure to support investment research and operational processes.
• Establish and maintain strong working relationships with portfolio managers and quantitative researchers.
• Contribute to automation projects to meet business requirements, considering recommended technologies, non-functional requirements, and internal policies and procedures.
• Participate in all stages of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), including gathering business requirements, analysis, code reviews, testing, and deploying applications.
• Liaise with service providers to clarify requirements, manage expectations, and resolve issues.

Qualifications and experience:
• Bachelor’s degree or higher in a relevant field.
• 0-5 years of experience in software development and engineering, preferably in financial domains.
• Experience and interest in VBA are highly desirable.
• Fresh graduates are welcomed; availability to work part-time before graduation is a plus.
• Proficiency in English.
• Experience with SQL databases.
• Experience with development work in Linux environments, Docker, or other container technologies.
• Experience with quantitative data analytics is a plus.
• Experience with Python is a plus.
• Experience with DevOps and Cloud tools is a plus.
• Experience with JavaScript frameworks is a plus.

Qualities we look for:
• Proficiency in one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages.
• Fundamental knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle.
• Fundamental understanding of agile methodologies such as CI/CD, application resiliency, and security.
• Good foundation in general computer science.
• Interest in VBA development
• Strong communication skills.
• High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
• Numeracy and a logical approach to problem-solving.
• Interest in investing, statistics, and data science.
• Creativity to think differently and see the bigger picture.
• Ability to work in an organized and efficient manner on time-sensitive tasks.
• A self-starter, fast learner, and comfortable working autonomously while being a team player.
• Willingness to go above and beyond for long-term success.
• Highest ethical standards and an intuitive understanding of the importance of putting the client first.

Please email your resume and a cover letter of no more than two pages outlining why you believe you are suitable for this to us.

title: Quantitative Researcher (PhD)
description:
Who are we?

The Itarle Groups is an industry-leading supplier of best execution algorithmic trading, smart order routing and transaction cost analysis services to clients ranging from global investment bank to specialist brokers. To support its Hong Kong operation across both equities and listed derivates, and to facilitate the increasing demand for its services, Itarle (HK) lts is seeking talent to monitor, support and grow the Itarle services in Hong Kong and contribute to the expansion of the Itarle brand around the globe.

• PhD in computer science, Econometrics, Electronic Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or Statistics.

• Experience in Java or C++ on very large data sets
• Self-motivated with high curiosity
• Ability to work independently and with a team

• Linear and non-linear time series and spectral analysis (ARMIA, TAR, VAR, SSA etc...)

Benefits:
• Bonus scheme

• Possibility to travel to global Itarle office

title: Senior Quantitative Researcher, Quantitative Strategies
description:

Job Description

Senior quantitative researcher as part of a small, collaborative team with a focus on equity and futures statistical arbitrage based in Asia

Location

Hong Kong, Singapore

• Combine sound financial insights and statistical learning techniques to explore, analyze, and harness a large variety of datasets in order to build strong predictive models which will be deployed to the investment process
• Collaborate with the PM in a transparent environment, engaging with the whole investment process

• Working knowledge of Matlab/Python and SQL are necessary

Preferred Experience
• Minimum of 5 years of experience as a quantitative researcher in a high, mid or low frequency systematic trading environment with a focus on equities and/or futures
• Experience trading in Chinese equity markets stat arb and/or equity index futures across Asian markets
• Demonstrated ability to conduct independent research using large data sets
• Candidates with quantitative development experience will be considered as well, provided they also have relevant research experience

Highly Valued Relevant Experience
• 5+ years of professional experience in a systematic trading environment (prop desk or hedge fund)
• Product experience in statistical arbitrage strategies

Target Start Date
• As soon as possible

Please direct all resume submissions to QuantTalentASIA@mlp.com and reference REQ-11767 in the subject.

title: Tier 1 Hedge Fund Fixed Income Quantitative Researcher Singapore
description:

• Conduct Alpha Research, Backtesting, and Risk Analysis
• Analyze Large-Scale Financial Datasets
• Collaborate with Portfolio Managers and Traders

About the Role:

We are seeking a highly skilled Quantitative Research Specialist to join our team at Selby Jennings. As a key member of our finance division, you will be responsible for developing and implementing systematic Fixed Income trading strategies using statistical and machine learning techniques.

You will conduct alpha research, backtesting, and risk analysis to enhance portfolio performance and collaborate with Portfolio Managers, traders, and engineers to integrate models into the trading framework. To succeed in this role, you should have an advanced degree (PhD/MSc) in a quantitative field and strong programming skills in Python, C++, or kdb+/Q. You should also be up-to-date on academic research, market trends, and regulatory changes to refine models and strategies.

title: Fixed Income Portfolio Manager
description:
CICC Fixed Income Portfolio Manager

Key Responsibilities:
• Manage fixed income investment portfolios under relevant regulations and specific requirements.
• Perform fundamental credit analysis by evaluating issuers' financial health, business models, and industry dynamics.
• Identify credit trends and event-driven opportunities across fixed income markets, employing both directional and relative value trades.
• Contribute to the team's thought leadership by identifying macro trends and investment themes.
• Provide regular updates and reports to senior management and clients on portfolio performance, market trends, and strategy adjustments.
• Contribute to the development of new fixed income products and investment solutions to meet evolving client needs.

Skills and Abilities:
• Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills, paired with the ability to think creatively about market opportunities.
• Strong decision-making under pressure, with a focus on capital preservation and return optimization.
• Ability to synthesize macroeconomic data and micro-level security analysis into actionable strategies.
• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate trade rationales to stakeholders and investors.
• Team-oriented, yet capable of independent decision-making in a high-stakes environment.

Qualifications:
• Upright, humble, diligent with high moral values.
• Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, or a quantitative discipline with CFA designation strongly preferred.
• 5 years of experience in fixed income portfolio management.
• Demonstrated success in generating alpha within fixed income markets, with a verifiable track record of strong performance.
• Expertise in fixed income asset classes, including investment-grade, high-yield in Asia, Europe, and the US.
• Experience with derivatives (e.g. forwards, options, futures, CDS) and their application in hedging strategies.
• Understanding of leverage, margin requirements, and counterparty risk.
• Prior experience managing SFC authorized public fund (experience as KIP) preferred.

CICC is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where every employee feels heard, supported, and empowered to contribute to the company's growth and success.

We strive to create an environment where diversity is valued, and we aim to drive innovation and achieve excellence in the industry.

It is CICC's responsibility to provide equal employment opportunities to all prospective employees, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, or any other characteristics protected by law.

The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of the work to be performed by employees within this classification.

title: Quantitative Strategist
description:
Quantitative Strategies Lead

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced professional to lead our Quantitative Strategies team for digital assets.
Job Overview

This role will focus on designing and building a new business line centered on delivering innovative trading and market optimization strategies.
• Develop and implement algorithmic trading strategies that leverage market data, quantitative models, and cutting-edge technology.
• Partner with the technology team to develop scalable, robust, and low-latency trading systems that support real-time execution and optimization of complex strategies.
• Stay abreast of market trends, evolving dynamics, and emerging technologies to refine strategies and identify opportunities for diversification and innovation in trading and liquidity solutions.
• Develop and implement risk management frameworks to ensure the safety and efficiency of trading operations.
Key Responsibilities
• Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, or a related discipline from a top-tier institution.
• Extensive experience in quantitative trading, HFT, or market making, ideally in digital assets or other asset classes.
• Proven track record of building and leading teams of quantitative researchers, developers, and traders.
• Deep understanding of market microstructure, liquidity dynamics, and algorithmic trading.
• Strong programming expertise, with proficiency in Python for data analysis and strategy development.
• Experience with low-latency programming languages such as Rust, particularly for high-performance trading systems.
• Familiarity with building scalable, real-time trading systems and tools.
• Exceptional leadership, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work across technical and non-technical teams.
• Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
What We Offer
• Competitive Salaries & Bonuses
• Generous Amounts of Paid Time Off (incl. leave for Birthdays, Work Anniversary, and Mental Health etc.)
• Access to Corporate Discounts and exclusive Employer Perks
• Medical & Retirement Plans
• Professional Learning and Development Opportunities
• Elevate your work using cutting-edge technology
• Fun & friendly office spaces
• Regular company & social events

title: Vice President, Risk and Quant Analytics
description:
About Polymer Capital
A market-neutral, multi-manager platform investing in liquid securities with a strong Asia focus, combines established institutional support and deep knowledge of local financial markets with a dedication to discovering and developing the region's best investment talent. With six offices around Asia-Pacific.

Job Description
• Collaborate with risk team members across Tokyo and other Polymer offices to ensure overall Risk Management of the Fund.
• Conduct daily monitoring of risk/P&L for the overall Fund and individual portfolios, engaging in bi-weekly meetings and ad hoc discussions with portfolio managers.
• Contribute to the development and implementation of quantitative analytics to gain deeper insights into the firm's investment activities.
• Develop a comprehensive understanding of applying proprietary analytics to individual portfolios and the overall fund.
• Provide support to portfolio managers on risk-related queries or proprietary risk management tools.
• Perform custom analyses of portfolios and/or returns as needed.
• Evaluate whether portfolios operate within approved fund guidelines and risk limits on an ongoing basis.
• Facilitate collaboration with Trading, Compliance, and Middle/Back Office departments to resolve issues affecting portfolio manager activities and performance.
• Participate in candidate interviews and risk assessments for potential portfolio managers at the firm.
• Maintain and update policies and procedures accordingly.

Requirements
• A minimum of five years' experience, preferably as a risk manager, ideally at a hedge fund or a hedge fund platform employing investment strategies such as long-short equities, macro, CTA, or multi-strategy.
• Experience as a hedge fund portfolio manager is highly desirable.
• An undergraduate or graduate degree in business, economics, or related subjects is preferred.
• Proficiency in using quantitative tools, including multi-factor risk modeling, to analyze portfolio risks and develop further analyses.
• A team player with excellent attention to detail, strong communication skills, and ability to guide others in implementing new ideas.
• A flexible approach to balancing theoretical ideals with commercial interests.
• A strong compliance mindset.
• Advanced Excel skills (including Visual Basic) are essential; modelling and Python programming skills are highly valued.

title: Graduate Quant Trader
description:
Da Vinci Graduate Quant Trader Role

We are building a team of trading enthusiasts at Da Vinci, a proprietary trading house founded in 2015. Our vision is focused on sustainable growth and collaboration across teams and offices.

We prioritize smart, innovative work and are hiring intelligent, inventive, laser-focused, and highly efficient individuals. As a Graduate Quant Trader, you will collaborate with a talented team of traders and engineers to develop, improve, and implement algorithmic trading strategies.

• You will analyze market data to develop new trading strategies and create tools that convert data analysis into practical trading inputs.
• Monitoring trades continuously and refining existing strategies will be your responsibility.

• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, MATLAB, R, or C++ is required.
• You must be able to understand and apply mathematical theory.
• Strong analytical problem-solving skills and a competitive yet cooperative attitude are necessary.
• A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset is also essential.
• Training provided by our dedicated in-house trainer will help you grow in your role.
What We Offer
• A base salary of 1 million HKD.
• Excellent variable pay and growth opportunities.
• Outstanding performance rewarded with shareholding options.
• Participation in social events and after-work activities.
Seniority Level and Employment Type
• This is an entry-level, full-time position within the finance industry, specifically in Financial Services and Capital Markets.

title: Systematic Trader (Proprietary LLM/AI) – Dubai | Lead & Build | Tax-Free
description:
At RGG Capital, we are seeking an experienced Systematic Trader (5+ years) to spearhead the development and execution of quantitative strategies within a new, dedicated trading function at RGG Capital HQ in Dubai. This role offers a unique opportunity to lead, innovate with proprietary AI, and build a significant trading operation backed by patient, long-term capital. Learn more about us: https://rgg.capital/

Reporting directly to the CEO and leading a Quantitative Analyst, you will be instrumental in deploying high-frequency, event-driven trading strategies across commodities and equities. Your core analytical advantage will be unique alpha signals generated from our proprietary Large Language Model (LLM) technology.

Why This Role Presents a Unique Opportunity:
• Define the Edge with Proprietary LLM: Collaborate directly with our AI/ML research team to refine, iterate, and enhance the alpha-generating capabilities of our unique LLM. Your insights will be critical in shaping our technological and trading advantage.
• Build, Lead & Scale with Impact: Assume responsibility for an initial $10M+ book with a clear framework for capital scaling based on performance. Lead a Quantitative Analyst and directly influence the architecture and growth of our systematic trading capability.
• Direct CEO Access & Focused Operational Environment: Benefit from direct strategic alignment with our CEO within a discreet, focused environment conducive to rigorous quantitative work, free from common external fund management pressures.
• Exceptional Tax-Free Rewards & Comprehensive Relocation: Competitive Salary: AED 50,000 - AED 65,000 per month (tax-free), complemented by a performance bonus structure (e.g., directly linked to P&L – details provided to qualified candidates). Full Relocation to Dubai: Including flights, visa sponsorship, and initial accommodation.
• Cutting-Edge Infrastructure & Resources: Operate within an agile setup with access to high-performance computing, sophisticated analytical tools, and the necessary resources for deploying and optimizing low-latency strategies.

Key Responsibilities & Strategic Objectives:
• Strategy & Alpha Generation: Translate LLM-derived signals into robust, profitable trading strategies; continuously research and implement enhancements to alpha and execution quality.
• Portfolio & Risk Management: Manage and scale a $10M+ systematic portfolio, implementing and refining advanced risk controls appropriate for HFT environments.
• Algorithm Optimization: Drive the evolution of trading algorithms to minimize transaction costs (slippage, latency) and maximize performance.
• LLM Feedback & Iteration: Provide critical, data-driven feedback to the AI/ML team to systematically improve the LLM's predictive accuracy and signal efficacy.
• Team Leadership & Development: Mentor and guide a Quantitative Analyst, fostering a culture of rigorous research, quantitative discipline, and high performance.

Candidate Profile: Qualifications & Experience:

Required:
• Minimum 5 years of experience as a Systematic Trader with a verifiable track record of P&L generation in commodities and/or equities.
• Deep expertise in quantitative technical analysis and the full lifecycle of algorithmic trading (HFT/low-latency development, backtesting, deployment, and optimization).
• Demonstrated experience managing and scaling systematic trading portfolios of $10M+ with sophisticated risk management frameworks.
• Advanced proficiency in Python, R, or a similar language for quantitative research, advanced backtesting, and algorithm development.
• Expertise in real-time risk monitoring, mitigation techniques, and statistical performance analysis for systematic strategies.
• Strong capability to collaborate effectively with, and provide precise, actionable insights to, AI/ML research teams.

Preferred:
• Experience in building or significantly scaling a systematic trading desk or a new suite of strategies.
• Direct market microstructure knowledge in energy, agriculture, or specific large-cap equity markets.
• Master’s or PhD in a relevant quantitative field (e.g., Financial Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science).

Our Commitment: Skills-First, Transparent Hiring Process:

We value demonstrable expertise. Our recruitment process is designed to be efficient, objective, and fair, commencing with a Phase 1 online assessment that allows candidates to showcase their practical skills. This enables us to identify highly capable individuals effectively.

Opportunity to Build a Leading AI-Driven Trading Operation:

If you are a results-oriented systematic trader with a strong interest in making a foundational impact within a well-capitalized, technologically advanced, and innovative trading environment, we encourage you to apply.

If your expertise aligns with this unique opportunity to lead and innovate with proprietary AI in a dynamic Dubai setting, we encourage you to take the next step.

Click "Apply" to submit your profile and participate in our skills-based Phase 1 assessment.

title: Senior Quant Researcher / Portfolio Manager - China ETF Arbitrage Strategies
description:

Role Overview:

title: Mid Frequency Equity Quant Researcher
description: Job OverviewWe are working with a prestigious international hedge fund renowned for our astute investment strategies and remarkable performance in the global financial arena. As we embark on expanding our operations, we are establishing a new, dynamic team and are actively seeking a highly skilled Low-Mid Frequency Equity Researcher. This is a unique opportunity to join a forward-thinking team at the heart of the financial industry, where you will play a pivotal role in driving our investment decisions through in-depth research and analysis of equity markets. You will work in a fast-paced, intellectually stimulating environment, leveraging your expertise to identify lucrative investment opportunities and contribute to the fund's growth and success.Key ResponsibilitiesResearch and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive fundamental and technical research on a wide range of equities. Analyze company financial statements, industry trends, economic indicators, and market sentiment to evaluate investment opportunities. Identify potential risks and rewards associated with different stocks, and provide in-depth reports and recommendations to the investment team. Stay updated on the latest market news, regulatory changes, and technological advancements that may impact equity markets, and incorporate this information into your research.Modeling and Valuation: Develop and maintain financial models to assess the value of companies and forecast their future performance. Use various valuation techniques, such as discounted cash flow analysis, relative valuation, and comparable company analysis, to determine the fair value of stocks. Regularly update and refine these models based on new data and market developments. Collaborate with the quantitative research team to incorporate statistical and econometric models into your analysis, enhancing the accuracy and reliability of your investment recommendations.Portfolio Support: Work closely with portfolio managers to assist in portfolio construction and management. Provide insights and recommendations on asset allocation, sector exposure, and individual stock selection. Monitor the performance of the portfolio's equity holdings, and conduct periodic reviews to ensure they align with the fund's investment strategy and risk tolerance. Participate in investment meetings and discussions, presenting your research findings and contributing to the development of the fund's overall investment approach.Data Management: Source, clean, and organize financial data from various internal and external databases. Ensure the accuracy and integrity of the data used in your research, and develop efficient data management processes to support your analysis. Collaborate with the data analytics team to explore new data sources and analytical tools, and leverage data-driven insights to enhance your research capabilities.Team Collaboration: Collaborate with other researchers, analysts, and traders within the firm. Share research findings, ideas, and best practices, and contribute to a collaborative and innovative research culture. Participate in cross-functional projects and initiatives, and work closely with the marketing and client service teams to communicate investment ideas and research results to clients and prospects.Qualifications and RequirementsExperience: Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in equity research, preferably in a hedge fund, investment bank, asset management firm, or other financial institution. Proven track record of successfully identifying investment opportunities and contributing to portfolio performance. Experience in low-mid frequency equity research, with a deep understanding of market dynamics and trading strategies at these frequencies.Skills: Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to analyze complex financial data and draw meaningful conclusions. Proficiency in financial modeling and valuation techniques, with experience using Excel, Bloomberg Terminal, and other financial analysis tools. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present research findings clearly and persuasively to both technical and non-technical audiences. Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and modeling is a plus.Knowledge: In-depth knowledge of equity markets, including different sectors, industries, and investment styles. Understanding of fundamental and technical analysis principles, and the ability to apply these techniques to equity research. Knowledge of financial accounting, corporate finance, and investment theory. Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance issues related to equity research and investment management.Education: A bachelor's degree in finance, economics, accounting, mathematics, statistics, or a related field. A master's degree in a relevant field, such as an MBA, Master of Finance, or Master of Economics, is highly preferred. Professional certifications such as CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) or CAIA (Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst) are a plus.

title: Quantitative Equity Market Risk Analyst
description:
Job Description:

Point72 Asset Management is seeking a Quantitative Equity Market Risk Analyst to join its Risk & Quantitative Research (RQR) team.

The RQR team plays a vital role in the Firm’s investment process, building a deeply rooted culture of efficient risk management and factful performance attribution. Quantitative Risk Analysts perform research to identify opportunities for improved risk management, investment behavior, and portfolio construction, with the goal of helping the firm deliver superior risk-adjusted performance. The paramount mission of the team is to protect the Firm from improper levels of exposure and ensure that risk-taking is always efficient and deliberate.

The Quantitative Risk Analyst will:
• Work in collaboration with the risk team to ensure the quantitative monitoring of equity market risks for the discretionary and systematic teams in Asia and New York.
• Research and develop risk analysis tools. These tools are based on various mathematical notions, such as statistical and econometric modeling of equity portfolios, multi-factor modeling, and indicator predictions using machine learning algorithms.
• Participate in the production of daily and weekly risk reports, which aim to monitor and explain the evolution of risks within equity portfolios, as well as in the various financial markets more generally.

We seek candidates with:
• Master’s degree (BAC + 5) or higher in quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or Computer Science)
• 2-5 years of experience in quantitative finance or data science
• High level of proficiency in quantitative programming (e.g. Python, MATLAB, R, SQL)
• Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team
• Ability to stay organized
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Fluency in English required

title: Trading Strategist / PM - HK
description:
Portfolio Manager
Athena Capital Research is a global quantitative investment manager with offices in New York and Hong Kong. With strengths in technology and finance, we combine discipline and creativity to achieve success in the growing field of automated trading. The firm was formed in 2003 and our Hong Kong office in 2010. The Hong Kong office is Athena’s Asia headquarters and manages the firm’s highly successful Asia-focused strategies. We are looking for exceptional individuals to join our elite team.

Job description
Our hedge fund specializes in fully automated trading. We have developed a best-in-class automated trading platform, featuring direct market access to major financial exchanges, and a complete system for developing and automating trading strategies. We will provide the technology, the capital, detailed historical data, lowest cost commissions, and highest quality executions—you will leverage these tools to build profitable trading strategies. We’ve built the body, you build the brains.
This position will be directly responsible for generating profits for the company. A core part of our culture is to share profits with people who are responsible for them. Therefore, this position is potentially very lucrative. We will provide you with the resources needed; it will be up to you to develop and drive these strategies to maximum profitability.

Key Responsibilities
• Build and maintain quantitative trading models by researching and establishing investment strategies
• Oversee daily performance and evaluate against historical data
• Assess portfolio to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, firm policies and portfolio investment strategies
• Collaborate with Trade Ops to ensure stable deployment of quantitative strategies

Requirements
• 3+ years managing and developing strategies and managing portfolio risk
• M.S. or Ph.D. degree from a top-tier school in a technical, scientific, and/or quantitative field
• 2+ years of experience with a major object oriented programming language (C++ / Java / C# preferred)
• 2+ years of experience working with Unix-based systems
• Strong desire to conquer the challenge of outperforming other financial market participants
• Self-motivated, hardworking, creative and competitive personality
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Desired Skills
• Statistical modeling, time series, machine learning, big data, or other data modeling experience
• Matlab, R, Stata, numPy, Pandas: expertise with any of these is a plus

title: Senior Quantitative Researcher
description:
Balyasny Asset Management (BAM) is a global, multi-strategy investment Firm with over $21 billion in assets under management. We are a diversified business, with global breadth and depth. Our Firm has a clear mission: To consistently deliver uncorrelated returns in all market environments. Today, BAM employs more than 160 portfolio managers and 1,200 investment professionals across 19 offices in the U.S., Europe, the Middle East, and Asia. We are active across six investing strategies: Equities Long/Short, Equities Arbitrage, Macro, Commodities, Systematic, and Growth Equity. We also have a dedicated private investment team, BAM Elevate, and a standalone equities unit, Corbets Capital.

ROLE OVERVIEW

PM Engagement coaches equity Portfolio Managers with a specific focus on portfolio construction, provides analytics and insights into their portfolio and process, and helps them grow their business to be successful/ profitable at BAM. The team works with teams across fundamental long/ short equity, index arbitrage, and merger arbitrage strategies. The team is involved in research on topics including equity portfolio analytics, factor/ factor model research, and analysis of best practices in the portfolio construction/ investment process.

The Senior Quantitative Researcher, PM Engagement, is responsible for working with equity PMs on their portfolio construction and investment process, helping them understand their risk taking and improve their profitability and scalability. The researcher will be expected to contribute to the development of quantitative models for the analysis of portfolio risk & performance for strategies, including alternative equity strategies. Leveraging his or her excellent communications skills and deep understanding how investment process, portfolio construction and analytics impact outcomes, the researcher will be responsible for developing models, conducting analysis, and sharing insights on drivers of P&L, best practices, and portfolio construction concepts with portfolio managers and business management.

The successful candidate should be passionate about equity investing with experience in Long/Short or alternative equity strategies, and possess advanced quantitative abilities, strong analytical skills, and be a strong communicator able to explain quantitative concepts and recommendations to other investment professionals. They will demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and an ability generate and execute creative ideas as the team builds analytics and tools to support and grow the business.

In the role of Senior Quantitative Researcher, PM Engagement, the employee will be responsible for the following:
• Improving profitability and scalability of the equities business at BAM by working directly with PMs to drive performance and scale; supporting tailored analysis with quantitative research and a deep understanding of the investment process.
• Research: Develop models for analysis of investment process, portfolio construction, risk and return attribution for strategies
• Understand team investment processes and how to capture and analyze relevant data
• Develop analysis supported by data for individual teams and/ or using data across the business to provide analysis on best practices, insights, and areas to improve risk-adjusted returns
• Propose and substantiate new research ideas that can be delivered to Portfolio Managers/ Business
• Respond to analytical questions from portfolio managers and senior management related to risk, portfolio construction, investment process
• Relationships and Advising: Managing relationships with Portfolio Managers and work with them to grow and improve profitability of their business. Functioning as a representative of equity risk, interface with PMs. Ensure that views / themes are accurately represented within portfolios
• Encourage dialogue / communication around analytics and offensive risk taking as well as risk guidelines
• Communicate analysis and recommendations clearly through face-to-face meetings, presentations and written documentation with global PM teams focused on equity strategies, as well as business management
• Guide PMs on use of tools, concepts and leveraging resources/ analytics and insights to improve their process, portfolio construction/ hedging
• Project Ownership: Collaborate with other Quantitative Researchers across Risk & Development, Data, Product and Engineering teams on accessing data sets and developing tools that improve Portfolio Managers or Business efficiency, profitability, and understanding of portfolio/ risks
• Deliver complex projects with multiple stakeholders
• Provide feedback on tools and help provide specifications for new tools

Qualifications:

The candidate must be able to demonstrate expertise in quantitative analysis techniques including statistical analysis, experience working with market data and large data sets programmatically, and strong analytical skills.

Additionally, the candidate should have experience with financial data and equity investment strategies including risk, performance attribution, and investment process.

Key qualifications include:
• 5+ years of experience working on a team with experience understanding risk/ portfolio construction and analytics related to equity Long/ Short or other alternative equity strategies, including at least 2 years of direct interaction with risk takers or in a risk-taking role
• Strong programming skills for quantitative analysis
• Strong Python skills – including prior experience with time series analysis, managing data, and contributing to internal analysis libraries in Python
• Experience with SQL for managing and accessing data
• Proficiency with software development process and tools such as GitHub
• Excellent communication/ presentation skills, confidence, and ability to influence, coach, educate fundamental PMs
• Outstanding written and oral communication skills
• Interest in learning from other investment experts, using feedback to improve analysis and understanding of strategies
• Understanding of quantitative research & investing
• Superior quantitative skills demonstrated through an advanced degree (PhD or Masters) in sciences/ math/ quantitative discipline and/ or practical experience applying quantitative finance theory
• Experience implementing statistical models
• Understanding of factor models and their applications
• Attention to detail and passion/ grit for getting things done, digging into problems, and helping develop solutions
• Sense of ownership and entrepreneurialism to grow the business
• Passion for investing / economics / stock market = Desire to work with portfolio teams focused on equity strategies

title: Quantitative Strategist
description:
Qube Research & Technologies (QRT) is a global quantitative and systematic investment manager, operating in all liquid asset classes across the world. We are a technology and data driven group implementing a scientific approach to investing. Combining data, research, technology, and trading expertise has shaped our collaborative mindset, which enables us to solve the most complex challenges. QRT is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome diversity as essential to our success. QRT empowers employees to work openly and respectfully to achieve collective success. In addition to professional achievement, we are offering initiatives and programs to enable employees achieve a healthy work-life balance.

title: Global Quantitative Strategies | Quantitative Researcher (Asia)
description:
Job Description
About Global Quantitative Strategies (GQS)
GQS is the quantitative investment business of Citadel. Founded in 2012, GQS has rapidly grown to become one of Citadel's core investment strategies and one of the top quantitative investment teams in the world. Agile teams of researchers, engineers, and traders develop robust systems that allow us to operate performant at scale and apply advanced statistical and quantitative modeling techniques to identify and act on investment opportunities.
Quantitative Researchers (QRs) specialize in a variety of areas, including but not limited to: using sophisticated data analysis skills to build predictive models, driving construction of a complex multi asset portfolio by utilizing large scale portfolio optimization techniques, and developing sophisticated optimization algorithms. Researchers with an exceptional record of achievement in their respective fields and a drive to apply quantitative techniques to investing are encouraged to apply to GQS.
Learn more about us here.
Required Skills and Qualifications:
• Advanced degree in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or a related field
• Proven ability to conduct innovative and impactful research focused on solving real-world problems
• Relentless focus on continuous learning and making an impact; ability to question the status quo
• Strong mathematical and statistical modeling skills (e.g., time-series and cross-sectional analysis)
• Proficiency in coding (C++ or Python preferred)
• Demonstrated passion for financial markets and driven to analyze and model drivers of price formation and risk

About Citadel
Citadel is one of the world's leading alternative investment managers. We manage capital on behalf of many of the world's preeminent private, public and nonprofit institutions. We seek the highest and best use of investor capital in order to deliver market leading results and contribute to broader economic growth. For over 30 years, Citadel has cultivated a culture of learning and collaboration among some of the most talented and accomplished investment professionals, researchers and engineers in the world. Our colleagues are empowered to test their ideas and develop commercial solutions that accelerate their growth and drive real impact.

title: Quant Researcher
description: Animoca Brands Corporation Limited (ACN: 122 921 813) is a Web3 leader that leverages tokenization and blockchain to deliver digital property rights to consumers, helping to establish the open metaverse and its associated network effects. Animoca Brands realizes its mission via three integrated business pillars: operating Web3 businesses to advance blockchain adoption with native projects such as Moca Network, Anichess, The Sandbox, Open Campus, NEOM Web3 initiatives, and a regulated stablecoin project in partnership with Standard Chartered and HKT; providing digital asset advisory services including tokenomics advisory, liquidity provisioning, and institutional research to help external Web3 projects grow; and investment management, with a portfolio of investments in over 540 companies including industry leaders Pudgy Penguins, Yuga Labs, Axie Infinity, Polygon, Consensys, Magic Eden, OpenSea, Dapper Labs, YGG, and many others.- Conduct quantitative research and analysis to develop trading strategies and investment models in the crypto market.- Utilize statistical techniques and data analysis tools to extract insights and identify market trends.- Design and implement trading algorithms and quantitative models to optimize trading performance and risk management.- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate quantitative research into trading strategies and investment decisions.- Stay updated on industry trends, market developments, and regulatory changes to inform research and decision-making processes. Master's or Ph.D. degree in quantitative finance, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or a related field, with a strong academic record.Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in quantitative research, preferably in the financial industry, with a demonstrated track record of success in developing and implementing trading strategies or quantitative models.Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, MATLAB, or C++ for data analysis, modeling, and algorithm development.Solid understanding of financial markets, including equity, fixed income, and derivatives, with a focus on the crypto market and its unique dynamics.Experience with quantitative research methodologies, including time series analysis, machine learning, optimization techniques, and backtesting frameworks.Knowledge of crypto-specific concepts such as blockchain technology, decentralized finance (DeFi), tokenomics, and smart contracts.Familiarity with crypto trading platforms, exchanges, and market data providers, as well as APIs for data retrieval and order execution.Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to critically evaluate data, identify patterns, and draw meaningful insights.Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex quantitative concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Proven ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams, with a proactive and solution-oriented approach to problem-solving.A passion for innovation and continuous learning, with a keen interest in staying abreast of the latest developments in quantitative finance, crypto markets, and emerging technologies.The Perks of Joining Animoca Brands:A Vibrant and Diverse Workplace: Immerse yourself in a dynamic, multi-cultural environment with colleagues from over 15 nationalities (and growing!). We celebrate diversity and foster a global perspective.Incentives in the Web3 Space: Be a part of the future and align your success with the growth of our innovative projects.Direct Impact and Flat Structure: Your voice matters. We operate with a flat organizational structure, ensuring your ideas are heard and implemented quickly.Comfortable and Creative Atmosphere: Embrace a relaxed and productive work environment with casual attire.Opportunities Across the Ecosystem: Expand your horizons by collaborating with various subsidiary brands within the Animoca Brands network, gaining exposure to a wide range of projects and technologies.Comprehensive Benefits Package: We care about your well-being.
