title: Associate / VP, Equity Finance Sales Trader
description:
Job Title: Equity Finance Sales Trader

Corporate Title: Associate/VP

Department: Global Markets

Location: Hong Kong

SFID: 9185

Company overview

Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning over 30 countries and regions. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its three business divisions: Retail, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking), and Investment Management. Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com.

Department Overview

Nomura's Global Markets department offers clients worldwide liquidity, market insights, and execution services across multiple asset classes, including equities, fixed income, currencies, and commodities. The team's emphasis on innovation and technology ensures access to advanced trading platforms and tailored solutions. Specializing in market-making, risk management, and electronic trading, Nomura's Global Markets team has a strong global presence and is renowned for 5xceptional client service. With expertise, global reach, and a commitment to innovation, the department is poised to drive growth and success in the financial industry.

Role Description

The Equity Finance Sales Trader will execute equity finance trades, including securities borrowing and lending transactions, with a focus on maximizing profitability whilst minimizing risk, build and maintain relationships with clients, and providing market insights to drive business growth.

Other responsibilities include:
• Provide Securities Borrowing Lending/Stock loan services to hedge fund clients and sourcing of supply from lenders and asset managers.
• Work closely alongside Dela One and Market Access teams to optimize inventory.
• Grow China inventory footprint alongside various stakeholders including sales, trading and management.
• Develop and maintain sales relationship with clients and other trading counterparties.
• Keep clients abreast of market colour, changes in market microstructure, and regulatory landscape to comply at all times to the rules and regulations set by the regulatory bodies relevant to the stockbroking industry.
• Collaborate with other GM stakeholders to augment client revenues across the franchise.

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree from an accredited university
• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in equity finance trading, with a strong emphasis on securities borrowing lending or stock loan services.
• Proficient in Python scripting.
• Excellent quantitative and analytical skills to interpret market data and trends effectively.
• Proficient in trading platforms and financial analysis tools.
• Knowledge of regulatory frameworks related to securities lending and trading.
• Very strong command of Excel and PowerPoint.
• Self-starter, proactive and have a positive attitude, able to work independently and coordinate with key stakeholders within the firm.
• Able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment, and under pressure.
• Able to work long hours during crunch time / pre-events.

Diversity Statement

Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities, and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation.

DISCLAIMER: This Job Description is for reference only, and whilst this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, it is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, efforts, requirements or working conditions associated with the job. The management reserves the right to revise the job and may, at his or her discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Nomura is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: CIB - Equities - Sales Trader, Associate or Vice President
description:
Job Description
Are you ready to make an impact in a fast-paced trading environment? As a Sales Trader, you will play a crucial role in executing client orders and driving product development initiatives. This is your opportunity to leverage technology and analytics to enhance client execution and contribute meaningfully to revenue growth.
As a Sales Trader on our High Touch Sales Trading team, you will be responsible for executing client orders through direct market access and algorithmic trading. You will share responsibility for product development and IT initiatives, working in a dynamic and busy trading floor environment.
Job Responsibilities:
• Manage execution, liquidity, and exposure while supporting all aspects of the trading desk.
• Conduct pre-trade analysis, research index constituent changes, and design optimal strategies for large trades.
• Evaluate market developments to provide clients with accurate information.
• Contribute to revenue and client franchise; exploit revenue opportunities and minimize loss potential.
• Leverage technology and analytics for client execution and idea generation.
• Build trust with clients by understanding their needs and being responsive.
• Establish competence with clients around executing trades.
• Understand market drivers, market moves, and possess a thorough understanding of fundamental and technical aspects of the market.

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• Minimum 3 years of experience in Sales Trading or similar role.
• Fluency in English, Cantonese, and Mandarin, both spoken and written.
• Ability to balance analytical and technical skills with proven instinct.
• Exhibit sound judgment under pressure and maintain composure in challenging trading environments.
• Communicate concepts and ideas effectively, both verbally and in documentation.
• Discuss understanding of market variables and their impacts on products.
• Keep all relevant parties informed of key developments; provide a solution-based framework to business practice and clients.

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• Employ industry knowledge to interpret news and developments.
• Leverage programming and coding skills to enhance daily workflows and develop trade ideas/trends
• Understand firm's approach and policies for managing risks and follow applicable legal and regulatory rules.
• Engage others in active dialogue; drive group involvement and build collaboration with clients and internal constituencies.

About Us
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.
About the Team
J.P. Morgan's Commercial & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets, securities services and payments. Corporations, governments and institutions throughout the world entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. The Commercial & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.

title: Naphtha Trader | Hong Kong, HK | Remote
extensions: ['19 days ago', 'HK$600K a year', 'Work from home', 'Full-time']
description:
Our client is a commodities trading house primarily in the business of energy trading. The Group is involved in both physical and derivatives trading out of Singapore, Dubai, and London. The Naphtha Trader will be responsible for the development and promotion of Naphtha trading, interacting with related companies, especially in the Far East region. The successful candidate will have thorough knowledge and experience in Naphtha. This role will suit an entrepreneurially minded naphtha professional looking to progress in their career and up for a new challenge within an established but expanding global enterprise.

Responsibilities
• Build key Naphtha relationships (existing & new), partnerships & trading flows for the Far East region
• Utilize existing networks with suppliers, refiners, producers, traders, and endusers within the physical Naphtha marketplace
• Perform physical trading & related hedging, accountable for the book P&L delivery plan
• Set up strategic objectives for the longer-term business growth in the region
• Analyse the markets to identify the needs of the customers & propose strategic partnership opportunities

Requirements
• Degree in business, economics, engineering, or relevant field
• Excellent communication and negotiation ability
• Have a strong network of contacts in the global Naphtha industry
• Relevant experience in oil markets dealing with the main Naphtha end-users
• Excellent communication and negotiation ability
• Analytical mindset with excellent decision-making skills
• Able to thrive in a fast-paced work environment
• Proficiency in English and Mandarin Chinese

title: FICC Repo Trader
description: About Us: Huatai International Financial Holdings Company Limited (“Huatai International” or “the Company”), is the only overseas wholly-owned or controlled subsidiary of Huatai Securities. Huatai International is the Huatai Group’s international arm which plays as a crucial role in the group's internationalization strategy by: a) not only providing offshore capital market services (and a global business platform) but also provides onshore clients with valuable cross-border capital market services (aligned with the mainland China government’s policies and commercial intentions); b) actively making use of Huatai Securities’ leading position, distribution network and customer base in mainland China; c) integrating on a global basis across many jurisdictions and regions, a successful and fully integrated international financial platform with innovative financial services solutions. Huatai International operates as a holding company for consolidating all of the group’s cross-border businesses and companies under one umbrella, offering a truly unified and international business platform. In recognition of such international strength, the renowned international rating agency Standard and Poor’s has assigned Huatai International a “BBB+” rating (for long term) and “A-2” (for short-term). Develop and implement efficient financing strategies and plans, and broaden funding related instruments. title: Senior Equity Derivatives Trader
description:
My client is a leading global investment bank currently hiring for a Senior Equity Derivatives Trader to join their Hong Kong team. Reporting to the Global Head of Derivatives Trading you will be responsible for the following:

Responsibilities
• Implement Financing and Investment Solutions incorporating specific strategies to ensure that performance objectives and long-term profits are met, helping the overall development of the Equity Derivatives trading business.
• Establish and maintain frameworks to ensure flow trading processes are efficient, appropriate and compliant, working in partnership with Trading teams globally to ensure the unique value of Equity products.
• You will also drive the PnL around Equity Derivatives, help drive new initiatives and manage the implementation of Funds and Structured Product strategies.

Requirements
• 10+ years experience in EQD Vol Trading (Index/single stock) from a reputable financial institution
• Master's or ideally PhD in Financial Engineering or a related field.
• Proven ability to handle quantitative models, and experience with structured products and pricing.
• Solid experience working with Sales teams in various regions to promote products
• An ability to maximise total product income by ensuring effective end-to-end client identification, risk management, service and infrastructure.
• You will have the ability to assess risk and possess excellent interpersonal skills.

title: Equity Warrant Trading, Quantitative Trader - Analyst/Associate
location: Central And Western District, Hong Kong
description:
Job Description
Are you ready to take your career to the next level in a fast-paced trading environment? At JPMorgan Chase, we offer an exciting opportunity to work alongside industry leaders, making markets for a range of listed products in Asian exchanges. Your expertise will help shape the future of our trading desk, driving innovation and efficiency in risk management.
As an Analyst/Associate in our Equity Warrant Trading team, you will collaborate with senior traders to make markets for a range of listed products in Asian exchanges. You will assist in managing risk, liquidity, and exposure, and support all aspects of the trading desk, including trade and P&L analytics, algorithms/strategies development, and system enhancements. Additionally, you will analyze market dynamics to improve the efficiency of risk management.
Job Responsibilities:
• Perform data analysis and program strategies to enhance our market making system
• Partner with the Technology/Quant research team to enhance and automate existing tools and systems.
• Coordinate with control functions to ensure proper controls are in place.
• Engage in team meetings and business management to drive and deliver results.
• Ensure that all activities and duties are carried out in full compliance with regulatory requirements, firm-wide risk framework, and internal policies.
• Collaborate with senior stakeholders to effectively market make, and risk manage the portfolio.
• Work closely with the Sales team to drive the business forward.

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• 2-5 years relevant experiences in equity derivatives trading or electronic market making.
• Strong awareness of market structure changes and the impact of regulation.
• Proficient in Python and C++ programming languages.
• Extensive knowledge in data science.
• Experience working collaboratively in highly productive teams.
• High degree of numeracy.
• Strong communication skills, especially around complicated concepts.
• Works thoughtfully and logically.
• Strong and clear communicator.
• Motivated to learn and proactively seeks responsibility.
• Able to work in a pressured environment; tenacious and self-motivated.

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• Advanced degree in quantitative subjects like Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, etc.
• Experience with algorithmic trading strategies.
• Familiarity with Asian financial markets and regulations.

title: Bunker Trader (based in Hong Kong/Mainland China/Singapore)
description:
About the job

We have a current opportunity for a Bunker Trader role with an international bunker trading company on a permanent basis. The position can be based in Hong Kong/Mainaland/Singapore. For further information about this position please apply.

About the Role

We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Bunker Trader to join our marine fuels trading team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and maintaining strong relationships with clients and suppliers, negotiating bunker fuel deals, and ensuring timely and efficient delivery of marine fuels globally.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop and manage a portfolio of clients and suppliers in the marine fuel industry.
• Negotiate and close bunker fuel deals, ensuring competitive pricing and optimal margins.
• Monitor market trends, pricing, and competitor activity to identify trading opportunities.
• Coordinate with operations and logistics teams to ensure smooth delivery and post-fixture follow-up.
• Maintain accurate records of trades, contracts, and communications.
• Provide market intelligence and contribute to strategic trading decisions.
• Ensure compliance with internal policies and external regulations.

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Maritime Studies, or a related field.
• At least 2-5 years of experience in bunker trading or marine fuels
• Strong negotiation and communication skills.
• Proven ability to build and maintain client relationships.
• High level of initiative, self-motivation, and resilience.
• Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office and trading platforms.

Preferred Qualifications
• Existing client and supplier network in the marine fuels industry.
• Multilingual abilities, especially in English and Mandarin, are a plus.
• Knowledge of shipping operations and marine logistics.

What We Offer
• Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
• Dynamic and collaborative work environment.
• Opportunities for career growth and international exposure.
• Training and development programs.

Interested candidates, please submit your updated resume to Zoe (R21101838). We regret to inform that only successful shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Options Trader | Hong Kong, HK
description:
Eclipse Trading is one of Asia's leading proprietary derivatives trading firms. Founded in 2007, we have over 100 employees across 4 office locations – Hong Kong (our HQ), Sydney, Shanghai and Chicago. Our trading expertise and strategies are deployed across several markets globally, focusing on various products including equity derivatives, delta one, ETFs, commodity derivatives, and cryptocurrency. Technology is inextricably linked to our trading strategies, creating an environment powered by intellectual curiosity, problem solving, and innovation.

We are actively seeking an Options Trader to join our growing volatility trading team in Hong Kong. You will play a key role in managing and improving our systematic and positional options trading strategies. You will also collaborate extensively with our quantitative researchers and technologists to drive our trading system forward and unlock trading opportunities.

Responsibilities and Duties
• Manage and execute multiple options trading strategies, systematic market making and positional strategies
• Responsible for the risk management of the portfolio
• Monitor the market to identify trading opportunities and develop trading metrics based on proprietary research and data analysis
• Collaborate with other traders and quantitative researchers to optimise existing strategies and explore new alphas for the desk
• Work closely with quants, developers, and support staff to continually improve our trading infrastructure

What you offer
• Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field
• 2+ years of options market making experience
• Proven track record of profitability and consistent trading performance in options markets
• Deep understanding of equity option markets and the trading opportunities
• Strong knowledge of options pricing models and volatility analysis
• Prior experience in electronic trading systems
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make informed trading decisions
• Ability to thrive and make decisions in a fast-paced trading environment and handle pressure effectively
• Strong communication and collaboration skills
• Good command of spoken and written English

What we offer
• Dynamic and collaborative work environment
• Opportunity to contribute directly to the bottom line
• Mentorship and training opportunities
• A flat management structure, where everyone's voice is valued
• Work life balance within a multi-cultural environment
• Fully stocked kitchen for breakfast and lunch
• Attractive benefits package with discretionary bonus

Eclipse Trading is an equal opportunity employer and we believe that diversity and inclusion are essential pillars of our success as a company. We are dedicated to embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential.

All information provided will be treated in strict confidence and used solely for recruitment purposes.

Due to the high number of responses that we receive, we are only able to respond to successful applicants.

Huatai International is the Huatai Group’s international arm which plays as a crucial role in the group's internationalization strategy by: a) not only providing offshore capital market services (and a global business platform) but also provides onshore clients with valuable cross-border capital market services (aligned with the mainland China government’s policies and commercial intentions); b) actively making use of Huatai Securities’ leading position, distribution network and customer base in mainland China; c) integrating on a global basis across many jurisdictions and regions, a successful and fully integrated international financial platform with innovative financial services solutions. Huatai International operates as a holding company for consolidating all of the group’s cross-border businesses and companies under one umbrella, offering a truly unified and international business platform. In recognition of such international strength, the renowned international rating agency Standard and Poor’s has assigned Huatai International a “BBB+” rating (for long term) and “A-2” (for short-term). Get In Touch We invite you to introduce yourself to our recruiters, and we will be sure to reach out if we come across a role that aligns with your skills and qualifications. We value the opportunity to learn more about you and your professional background. Please provide us with your information, including your resume and any relevant details, so we can keep you in consideration for future opportunities. We appreciate your interest in joining our organization, and we look forward to the possibility of connecting with you soon! Why work here? At our organization, we strive to create an environment that fosters growth, collaboration, and innovation. We value our employees' contributions and provide ample opportunities for professional development. Our team is passionate, driven, and committed to making a meaningful impact. Join us to be part of a dynamic workforce where your skills and ideas are valued and where you can grow both personally and professionally. Together, let's achieve greatness and create a rewarding journey.

title: Quantitative Trader - Full Time
description:
About the Position

We are looking for Quantitative Traders to help us find and trade on price inefficiencies, develop models, manage risk, investigate new products, and push into new business areas. Our trading is based on our own proprietary models, and on busy days we engage in over a million trades across 200 trading venues around the world.

Our trading desks are central to our collaborative and cooperative office environment. You can expect to work side by side with experienced Traders who are committed to teaching, guiding, and supporting our newest hires from day one. Through hands-on, interactive training, you’ll acquire significant, real trading responsibilities within weeks to months of being on the desk. In parallel, you will participate in our robust year-long firmwide educational curriculum.

A profitable trading strategy is only as strong as the technology it runs on, and we consider ourselves as much a technology company as a trading firm. While exposure to a particular programming language is not required, general programming experience is a plus.

If you’d like to learn more, you can read about our interview process and meet some of our newest hires.

About You

We don’t expect you to have a background in finance or any other specific field—we’re looking for smart people who enjoy solving interesting problems. We’re more interested in how you think and learn than what you currently know. You should be:
• A critical thinker with a strong quantitative mind
• A collaborative problem-solver who enjoys working on a team
• Able to make decisions quickly in a fast-paced environment
• Proactive, reliable, and courteous with strong organizational and communication skills
• Eager to ask questions, admit mistakes, and learn new things
• Fluent in English

title: Vice President | Synthetic Equity Trader
description:
Join our Equity Finance business as a Synthetic Equity Trader. As part of a successful and highly supportive team, you’ll help drive sustained business growth and increased profitability for Macquarie in Asia.

While Macquarie offers hybrid working for many of our roles, this role does require 5 days a week in our office location.

At Macquarie, our advantage is bringing together diverse people and empowering them to shape all kinds of possibilities. We are a global financial services group operating in 31 markets and with 56 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a friendly and supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drives outcomes.

What role will you play?

You will trade various products, including equity swaps, p-notes, equities, futures and FX (spot and forward), across 11 regional markets. You will have ownership for the full trade lifecycle from pricing through to execution, post-trade management and P&L attribution.

You will be responsible for external relationships, including sell-side banks, brokers, intermediaries and asset owners, and drive positive commercial outcomes through originating, structuring and executing on trade ideas. Effective risk and control management is crucial in this role so you will work to ensure trading risks are foreseen, managed and escalated within the group framework.

What You Offer
• 7+ years of experience, including time in an equities trading role
• Detailed understanding of Asian equity markets including exchange rules, securities lending and short-sell regulations
• Strong swaps knowledge of product structure, lifecycle events, margining, funding and capital requirements
• Coding and Asian language capabilities would be an advantage.

We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.

About Commodities and Global Markets

Commodities and Global Markets is a global business offering capital and financing, risk management, market access, physical execution and logistics solutions to its diverse client base across Commodities, Financial Markets and Asset Finance.

Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion

We are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and welcome all identities, including race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, gender (including gender identity or expression), age, sexual orientation, marital or partnership status, parental, caregiving or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disability, or socio-economic background. We welcome further discussions on how you can feel included and belong at Macquarie as you progress through our recruitment process.

Our aim is to provide reasonable adjustments to individuals who may need support during the recruitment process and through working arrangements. If you require additional assistance, please let us know in the application process.

All applications applied through our system will be delivered directly to the advertiser and privacy of personal data of the applicant will be ensured with security.

title: Graduate Quant Trader
description:
About Da Vinci

Da Vinci is a proprietary trading house founded in 2015 and specialised in solving market inefficiencies, identifying opportunities based on volatility arbitrage and delta1 strategies and providing liquidity to the markets. We are headquartered in the home of the world’s first stock market, Amsterdam, and we have offices in Miami, Mumbai and Hong Kong. Today, we trade on the most prominent exchanges across Asia and the US. Our vision is set on sustainable growth and collaboration across teams and offices.

We always keep our work smart and innovative and are building a team of trading enthusiasts. The key to our success is hiring not only intelligent but inventive, laser-focused and highly efficient individuals. Across all departments; trading, quantitative research and development alike, Da Vinci is made up some of the sharpest minds and most passionate players in the industry. We are non-hierarchical and support employees in exploring their interests and strengths, placing no limit on personal growth.

About the Role

As a Graduate Quant Trader at Da Vinci, you’ll work alongside a fun team of highly skilled traders and engineers. Our Quant Traders are key to developing, improving and implementing algorithmic trading strategies that help us reach our goal of building one of the best proprietary trading firms in the world.

Da Vinci offers an exciting and dynamic work environment, where employees are given the freedom to come up with great ideas and the space to push these to completion. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be part of a successful and fast-growing company.

Responsibilities:
• Analyse market data to build new trading strategies
• Develop tools that translate data analysis results into useful inputs for trading
• Continuously monitor trades and improve our existing strategies
• Evaluate prospective markets for opportunities

Requirements:
• Technical background (Maths, Physics, Engineering, Econometrics, Quant Finance or similar quantitative studies) with an interest for the financial markets
• Programming knowledge in Python, MATLAB, R or C++
• Ability to understand mathematical theory and translate it into practice
• Good communication skills
• Attention to detail
• Analytical approach to solving complex problems
• Competitive but cooperative attitude
• Proactive and entrepreneurial mindset

Benefits
• A comprehensive theoretical and practical training program provided by our dedicated in-house trainer
• Base salary of 1mln HKD
• Excellent variable pay and growth opportunities
• Outstanding performance is also rewarded with shareholding in the company
• Meals during work hours
• Social events and after-work drinks

title: Vice President / Director, Equity Derivatives - Option Trader for India and Systematic Strategies, Global Equities, Hong Kong
description:
Job Description:

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. We do this by driving Responsible Growth and delivering for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.

Being a Great Place to Work is core to how we drive Responsible Growth. This includes our commitment to being an inclusive workplace, attracting and developing exceptional talent, supporting our teammates' physical, emotional, and financial wellness, recognizing and rewarding performance, and how we make an impact in the communities we serve.

Bank of America is committed to an in-office culture with specific requirements for office-based attendance and which allows for an appropriate level of flexibility for our teammates and businesses based on role-specific considerations.

At Bank of America, you can build a successful career with opportunities to learn, grow, and make an impact. Join us!

Job Description:

Our APAC Equity Derivatives business is looking to hire a Senior Option Trader for India and Systematic Strategies to join the team in Hong Kong. Ideal candidates will have relevant experience in equity derivatives trading desk and able to demonstrate strong quantitative skills and solid knowledge.

Responsibilities:
• The role is responsible for managing risk and developing trading activities with limited direction from senior staff. Daily responsibilities will include pricing, hedging, trading, booking, reporting risk and P&L.
• Proactively maintaining and building client relationships, supporting clients with buying and selling financial products, and implementing trading strategies to achieve revenue goals.
• Having in-depth knowledge of risk management, hedging, and trading strategies as well as market characteristics.
• Partners with sales teams to help the bank's clients execute trading activities, while sharing knowledge of the current market environment.
• Performs trading activities in compliance with regulations, industry standards, and other requirements and ensures trading orders are executed with the highest degree of accuracy and time efficiency.
• Assigns accounts to pre-defined trading models and administers trades based on product guidelines.
• Operates as a market maker, buying and selling financial instruments in accordance with established trading strategies and risk parameters.

Requirements:
• Minimum 6-8 years of relevant experience in equity derivatives option trading for India market and systematic strategies.
• Solid knowledge and understanding of equities products, markets dynamics and risk management.
• Strong programming (Python) skills, analytical and data skills.
• Aptitude to work well under fast paced environment.
• Excellent communication skills, reasoning and problem solving.

Skills:
• Trading
• Trade Monitoring
• Trading and Investment Analysis
• Trading Strategy
• Business Acumen
• Risk Management
• Client Management

title: Execution Trader
extensions: ['5 days ago', 'HK$30K–HK$40K a month', 'Full-time', 'No degree mentioned']
description:
The role of this Execution Trader position offers an exciting opportunity to work for one of the top Chinese Healthcare Investment firm in Hong Kong.

Client Details

A leading Chinese healthcare-focused investment firm with a dual-platform strategy encompassing both hedge fund and private equity operations. With offices strategically located in Hong Kong and Shanghai, they leverage deep industry expertise and a robust research-driven approach to identify high-potential opportunities across the healthcare value chain. The investment philosophy combines long-term value creation with agile capital deployment, enabling us to navigate both public and private markets effectively. The team is composed of seasoned professionals with global experience and a shared commitment to innovation, integrity, and impact in the healthcare sector.

Description

As an Execution Trader, your main responsibilities will include:
• Execute trades across a broad range of asset classes including:
• Global equities (China A-shares, Hong Kong, US, Europe, Japan, Korea, Australia)
• Fixed income (USD-denominated corporate bonds, US Treasuries)
• Derivatives (equity index futures, swaps, FX forwards)
• Options strategies (e.g., call spreads, put spreads)
• Monitor order flow and market dynamics in real time; provide timely market color and actionable insights to the investment team.
• Liaise with brokers and counterparties to ensure best execution and maintain strong trading relationships.
• Collaborate with the back office to ensure accurate and timely trade settlement; proactively resolve any trade discrepancies or operational issues.
• Support ad hoc projects and cross-functional initiatives as assigned by the investment or operations team.

Profile

A successful Execution Trader should have:
• 2- 3 years experiences in multi-asset trade execution, preferably within a hedge fund or asset management environment.
• Strong understanding of global markets and trading protocols.
• Excellent communication skills in Mandarin, Cantonese and English.
• Attention to details
• Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Job Offer
• Opportunities for career progression and skill development within financial services.
• A professional and supportive team environment in the Healthcare investment firm.
• Exposure to diverse trading strategies and market instruments.
• Potential for performance-based incentives and rewards.

If you are ready to take on a challenging yet rewarding role as a Trader in the financial services industry, we encourage you to apply today!

title: HK Single Stock Options Market Making Trader
description:
We are seeking a Senior Market Making Trader to join a leading global hedge fund in Hong Kong, specializing in single stock options market making. The role focuses on systematic trading, leveraging quantitative strategies and technology, with some off-screen trading. Candidates must have a strong understanding of Hong Kong’s market structure, including stamp duty rebates, and proficiency in technology-driven trading systems.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop and execute systematic market making strategies for Hong Kong single stock options
• Analyze market data and microstructure to optimize pricing, hedging, and risk management
• Leverage quantitative models to enhance trading decisions and improve profitability
• Engage in off-screen trading to facilitate large orders and maintain liquidity
• Optimize trading strategies to maximize stamp duty savings and rebates
• Collaborate with quants and engineers to integrate advanced technology into trading systems
• Monitor and manage risk exposure, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements
• Continuously improve trading algorithms and execution systems to reduce latency and enhance performance

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering).
• 4–5 years of senior-level experience in market making, preferably in Hong Kong single stock options.
• Proven expertise in systematic trading and quantitative strategy development.
• Strong understanding of Hong Kong market microstructure, including stamp duty savings and rebate mechanisms.
• Proficiency in trading technology, including low-latency systems and algorithmic trading platforms.
• Experience with off-screen trading and managing large order flows.
• Familiarity with programming (e.g., Python, C++) for data analysis or strategy implementation is a plus.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.
• Strong communication skills for collaboration with traders, quants, and technology teams.

title: Graduate Trader
description:
Flow Traders is looking for students interested in being Graduate Traders to join our growing Trading team in Hong Kong. The ideal candidate is competitive, driven and passionate about the financial markets. This is a unique opportunity to join a leading proprietary trading firm with an entrepreneurial and innovative culture at the heart of its business. We value quick-witted, creative minds and challenge them to make full use of their capacities.

What you will do

As a Graduate Trader, you will begin your career at Flow Traders with an extensive 3 month training program at our Amsterdam office. During this program, you will learn everything you need to know about our core business, the financial products we trade and the intricacies surrounding our trading processes, including pricing strategies and our proprietary trading systems. It will also include participation in trading simulations and quantitative classes hosted by our Senior Traders and Quantitative Researchers that will further strengthen your understanding of a Trader’s role in the financial ecosystem. After collaborating with your fellow graduate traders on a team project to conclude the training program, you will be assigned to an established trading desk based on your skills and interests. Gradually, you will take on more responsibilities, start monitoring markets and be able to make split-second decision to contribute to the overall profitability of your desk!

What you need to succeed
• University degree, preferably in Finance, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related
• Demonstrable interest in trading and global financial markets
• Understanding of financial products
• Proficiency in Excel, a keen interest in IT systems and an affinity for development languages
• Ability to deliver under pressure, with excellent mental arithmetic and analytical skills
• Ability to spot arising opportunities and the assertiveness to seize them
• An entrepreneurial mindset that thrives on creative problem solving
• Collaborative team player with strong communication skills
• Attracted to a fast-paced, team oriented work environment that offers great challenges and rewards

Flow Traders does not accept unsolicited resumes from any professional staffing or search firms. All resumes, and any other information identifying potential candidates, submitted to any employee at Flow Traders via-email, the Internet or directly without a valid and signed search agreement will be deemed free to contact by Flow Traders without any restrictions and no placement fee of any kind will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Flow Traders.

title: Coverage Trader - Market Making
description:
Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Amber Group is a leader in digital asset trading, products and infrastructure. We work with companies ranging from token issuers, banks and fintech firms, to sports teams, game developers, brands and creators. Operating at the center of markets, we act as liquidity providers, miners and validators on all major exchanges, applications, and networks. Across all products and categories, we have turned over >$1T in volumes since inception. Our mission is to make our digital future a reality and shape it to be fair, inclusive, and kind.

Our people are both dreamers and doers - a self-driven, entrepreneurial community who are believers in the power of decentralized networks. We collaborate across teams and regions, promoting a culture that is open, transparent, respectful and inclusive.

Our businesses

1. Institutional financial services, helping 1,000+ asset managers, hedge funds, corporates, and family offices invest in digital assets via API and our OTC desk.

2. Consumer financial services with millions of customers investing in digital assets via our award-winning mobile app and web platforms.

3. The emerging digital creator economy including gaming tokens, digital art, sports collectibles, and social tokens.

At Amber Group, you will have the opportunity to work with innovative and entrepreneurial people, solve meaningful problems, accept challenges, and become experts in frontier fields. We strive to take care of our people, providing competitive incentives, benefits and rewards.

Role and Responsibilities:
Manage the inventory of tokens and cryptocurrencies in order to balance buy and sell orders and minimize risk. Work with ICO issuers to facilitate primary market transactions and ensure timely and efficient execution. Analyze market trends and news to identify potential market making opportunities. Monitor market conditions and adjust trading strategies as needed to optimize performance. Have strong analytical, quantitative, and interpersonal skills, as well as a deep understanding of crypto markets. Manage complex trades and positions and stay up-to-date on crypto market trends and regulatory changes. Have a deep understanding of the ICO process and the ability to evaluate the risks and opportunities associated with new tokens.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, or related field. At least 1 years of trading experience in the crypto industry. Extensive knowledge of financial markets and trading strategies, especially market making. Strong analytical, quantitative, and interpersonal skills. Deep understanding of the ICO process and the ability to evaluate the risks and opportunities associated with new tokens. Ability to manage complex trades and positions and stay up-to-date on crypto market trends and regulatory changes. Excellent communication and negotiation skills.

Amber Group opens its doors to the curious problem solver empowered to make an impact in shaping tomorrow. As a hyper-growth company since day 1, we continually invite talent to join our diverse, nimble and digitally-native teams. If this sounds like you, apply now, or get in touch with us today at

title: Crypto Trader Hong Kong
description:
Eclipse Trading is one of Asia's leading proprietary derivatives trading firms. Founded in 2007, we have over 100 employees across 4 office locations – Hong Kong (our HQ), Sydney, Shanghai and Chicago. Our trading expertise and strategies are deployed across several markets globally, focusing on various products including equity derivatives, delta one, ETFs, commodity derivatives, and cryptocurrency. Technology is inextricably linked to our trading strategies, creating an environment powered by intellectual curiosity, problem solving, and innovation.

We are actively seeking a Crypto Trader who will play a pivotal role in executing and managing crypto trading strategies. Your focus will be on driving profitability while effectively managing risk. Utilizing your extensive market knowledge and analytical abilities, you will make informed trading decisions.
Responsibilities and Duties
Trade delta one products and options in cryptocurrency markets to generate consistent P&L through market making, volatility trading, and market-neutral strategies. Responsible for the risk management of the portfolio across traditional, centralized and decentralized exchanges. Develop and implement alpha-generating trading strategies, leveraging market trends and crypto-specific inefficiencies. Collaborate with quantitative researchers and developers to design, backtest, and automate trading systems and workflows. Optimize trade execution and liquidity provision, adapting to evolving market structures. Contribute to the development of proprietary tools and algorithms to improve trading efficiency and scalability.

What you offer
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics or any other analytical / quantitative related field of study. Minimum 4 years of proven experience trading delta one products (e.g., spot, futures, perpetual swaps) in cryptocurrency markets, with a track record of generating consistent P&L. Experience or familiarity with options trading, including pricing, hedging, or volatility strategies, to complement delta one expertise. Proficiency in Linux OS and Python for scripting, strategy development, and data analysis to support trading decisions and automation. Deep understanding of cryptocurrency market microstructure, including centralized exchanges, decentralized exchanges and funding rate dynamics. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make quick and informed trading decisions. Ability to thrive and make decisions in a fast-paced trading environment and handle pressure effectively. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Good command of spoken and written English.

What we offer
Dynamic and collaborative work environment. Opportunity to contribute directly to the bottom line. A flat management structure, where everyone's voice is valued. Work life balance within a multi-cultural environment. Fully stocked kitchen for breakfast and lunch. Attractive benefits package with discretionary bonus.

Eclipse Trading is an equal opportunity employer and we believe that diversity and inclusion are essential pillars of our success as a company. We are dedicated to embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential.

All information provided will be treated in strict confidence and used solely for recruitment purposes.

Due to the high number of responses that we receive, we are only able to respond to successful applicants.

title: FICC - Junior Trader - Analyst / Associate
company_name: Huatai International Financial Holdings Co., Ltd.
description:
About Us:
Huatai International Financial Holdings Company Limited (“Huatai International” or “the Company”), is the only overseas wholly-owned or controlled subsidiary of Huatai Securities. Huatai International is the Huatai Group’s international arm which plays as a crucial role in the group's internationalization strategy by:
a) not only providing offshore capital market services (and a global business platform) but also provides onshore clients with valuable cross-border capital market services (aligned with the mainland China government’s policies and commercial intentions);
b) actively making use of Huatai Securities’ leading position, distribution network and customer base in mainland China;
c) integrating on a global basis across many jurisdictions and regions, a successful and fully integrated international financial platform with innovative financial services solutions.

Huatai International operates as a holding company for consolidating all of the group’s cross-border businesses and companies under one umbrella, offering a truly unified and international business platform. In recognition of such international strength, the renowned international rating agency Standard and Poor’s has assigned Huatai International a “BBB+” rating (for long term) and “A-2” (for short-term).

Key Responsibilities:

• Cultivate and maintain external trading relationships with brokers, dealers, and trading platform providers.
• Collaborate with investment managers to onboard new trading instruments and ensure seamless integration.

• Solid understanding of financial instruments and a strong desire to expand trading expertise.
• Strong analytical & quantitative skills, with proficiency in Python, R, MATLAB, or similar programming tools.
• Excellent communication skills, teamwork mentality, and ability to perform under pressure.

description: 職位名稱：電力交易員 (Power Trader) 崗位職責：1. 監控香港及粵港澳大灣區電力市場實時價格波動，制定即日/日前交易策略 2. 執行電力現貨、期貨及衍生工具交易，管理倉位風險 3. 分析電力供需數據（負荷預測、新能源出力、輸電阻塞等） 4. 開發量化交易模型，優化套戥與對沖方案 5. 對接發電廠、電網及大用戶，協商長期購售電協議（PPA） 6. 跟進碳交易政策（如香港碳市場試點），設計綠電交易組合 任職要求： 1. 碩士以上學歷2. 3年或以上能源交易經驗，熟悉香港及粵港澳大灣區電力市場規則（中電/港燈系統）3. 精通電力衍生工具定價（電力期貨、差價合約CFD）4. 熟練使用Python/MATLAB進行量化分析，掌握PLEXOS/PROPHET等專業工具 5. 英語流利（書面及口語），粵語為加分項 6. 抗壓能力強

title: Systematic Trader (Proprietary LLM/AI) – Dubai | Lead & Build | Tax-Free
description:
At RGG Capital, we are seeking an experienced Systematic Trader (5+ years) to spearhead the development and execution of quantitative strategies within a new, dedicated trading function at RGG Capital HQ in Dubai. This role offers a unique opportunity to lead, innovate with proprietary AI, and build a significant trading operation backed by patient, long-term capital. Learn more about us: https://rgg.capital/

Reporting directly to the CEO and leading a Quantitative Analyst, you will be instrumental in deploying high-frequency, event-driven trading strategies across commodities and equities. Your core analytical advantage will be unique alpha signals generated from our proprietary Large Language Model (LLM) technology.

Why This Role Presents a Unique Opportunity:
• Define the Edge with Proprietary LLM: Collaborate directly with our AI/ML research team to refine, iterate, and enhance the alpha-generating capabilities of our unique LLM. Your insights will be critical in shaping our technological and trading advantage.
• Build, Lead & Scale with Impact: Assume responsibility for an initial $10M+ book with a clear framework for capital scaling based on performance. Lead a Quantitative Analyst and directly influence the architecture and growth of our systematic trading capability.
• Direct CEO Access & Focused Operational Environment: Benefit from direct strategic alignment with our CEO within a discreet, focused environment conducive to rigorous quantitative work, free from common external fund management pressures.
• Exceptional Tax-Free Rewards & Comprehensive Relocation: Competitive Salary: AED 50,000 - AED 65,000 per month (tax-free), complemented by a performance bonus structure (e.g., directly linked to P&L – details provided to qualified candidates). Full Relocation to Dubai: Including flights, visa sponsorship, and initial accommodation.
• Cutting-Edge Infrastructure & Resources: Operate within an agile setup with access to high-performance computing, sophisticated analytical tools, and the necessary resources for deploying and optimizing low-latency strategies.

Key Responsibilities & Strategic Objectives:
• Strategy & Alpha Generation: Translate LLM-derived signals into robust, profitable trading strategies; continuously research and implement enhancements to alpha and execution quality.
• Portfolio & Risk Management: Manage and scale a $10M+ systematic portfolio, implementing and refining advanced risk controls appropriate for HFT environments.
• Algorithm Optimization: Drive the evolution of trading algorithms to minimize transaction costs (slippage, latency) and maximize performance.
• LLM Feedback & Iteration: Provide critical, data-driven feedback to the AI/ML team to systematically improve the LLM's predictive accuracy and signal efficacy.
• Team Leadership & Development: Mentor and guide a Quantitative Analyst, fostering a culture of rigorous research, quantitative discipline, and high performance.

Candidate Profile: Qualifications & Experience:

Required:
• Minimum 5 years of experience as a Systematic Trader with a verifiable track record of P&L generation in commodities and/or equities.
• Deep expertise in quantitative technical analysis and the full lifecycle of algorithmic trading (HFT/low-latency development, backtesting, deployment, and optimization).
• Demonstrated experience managing and scaling systematic trading portfolios of $10M+ with sophisticated risk management frameworks.
• Advanced proficiency in Python, R, or a similar language for quantitative research, advanced backtesting, and algorithm development.
• Expertise in real-time risk monitoring, mitigation techniques, and statistical performance analysis for systematic strategies.
• Strong capability to collaborate effectively with, and provide precise, actionable insights to, AI/ML research teams.

Preferred:
• Experience in building or significantly scaling a systematic trading desk or a new suite of strategies.
• Direct market microstructure knowledge in energy, agriculture, or specific large-cap equity markets.
• Master’s or PhD in a relevant quantitative field (e.g., Financial Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science).

Our Commitment: Skills-First, Transparent Hiring Process:

We value demonstrable expertise. Our recruitment process is designed to be efficient, objective, and fair, commencing with a Phase 1 online assessment that allows candidates to showcase their practical skills. This enables us to identify highly capable individuals effectively.

Opportunity to Build a Leading AI-Driven Trading Operation:

If you are a results-oriented systematic trader with a strong interest in making a foundational impact within a well-capitalized, technologically advanced, and innovative trading environment, we encourage you to apply.

If your expertise aligns with this unique opportunity to lead and innovate with proprietary AI in a dynamic Dubai setting, we encourage you to take the next step.

Click "Apply" to submit your profile and participate in our skills-based Phase 1 assessment.

title: Trading Analyst
description:
Who are we?

title: Trader Support APAC - 10192
description:
The Role:The Hong Kong Service Desk provides Fidessa’s first line support service to customers and forms part of Fidessa’s global support team. The desk is responsible for providing both on-site and remote support to users and trading support personnel, maintaining a strong relationship with clients as well as developing a deep understanding of client systems and business practices.

Key Responsibilities
• Analyses each call, using business acumen to identify the nature of the incident and action appropriately
• Deals with calls immediately, either independently or by passing to the appropriate team to ensure optimum resolution
• Attends client site to assist with issue resolution and increase business knowledge where requested
• Participates in the team shift patterns and assists with weekend work and out of hours escalation when required
• Develops strong working relationships with other departments to assist with the delivery of our service to clients. Adheres to "best practice" and department procedures for client communications, incident progression and investigation

Required Skills, Qualifications and Experience
• First-hand experience of supporting trading systems in a production environment
• Have an enquiring mind with an analytical and proactive approach to problem solving, even when under pressure. Able to view situations from a customer perspective and act accordingly
• Service desk analysts need to be dynamic, resilient and objective, delivering rapid and accurate solutions to the incidents raised by customers
• First class English written and verbal communication skills, fluency in Cantonese/Mandarin
• A strong desire to develop a deep understanding of financial markets and business flows and Fidessa's functionality

About us: We’re a diverse group of visionary innovators who provide trading and workflow automation software, high-value analytics, and strategic consulting to corporations, central banks, financial institutions, and governments. Founded in 1999, we’ve achieved tremendous growth by bringing together some of the best and most successful financial technology companies in the world. Over 2,000 of the world’s leading corporations, including 50% of the Fortune 500 and 30% of the world’s central banks, trust ION solutions to manage their cash, in-house banking, commodity supply chain, trading and risk. Over 800 of the world’s leading banks and broker-dealers use our electronic trading platforms to operate the world’s financial market infrastructure.ION is a rapidly expanding and dynamic group with 13,000 employees and offices in more than 40 cities around the globe. Our ever-expanding global footprint, cutting edge products, and over 40,000 customers worldwide provide an unparalleled career experience for those who share our vision.

title: Junior Synthetic Delta One Trader
description:
Job Description

The KGI Group is a multi-faceted, pan-Asian financial services group that excels in providing exceptional service to its clients. With over three decades of experience, the company prides itself on its integrity, professionalism, and prudent decision-making.

KGI Hong Kong operates as one of Hong Kong's largest equity brokers by market share and one of the top ten futures brokers. Our full-service brokerage firm caters to both retail and institutional clients, aiming to provide comprehensive financial services.
Key Responsibilities:
• Swap Desk Execution: Manage the daily execution and order management of our synthetic swap desk, ensuring efficient market execution and adherence to regulatory requirements.
• Hedging Solutions: Execute Spot FX / FX Swaps / NDFs for hedging purposes, providing clients with tailored solutions.
• Equity Finance Collaboration: Work closely with our Equity Finance team to optimize funding and inventory levels.
• Client Coverage: Collaborate with our sales team to cover clients from a trading perspective, ensuring their needs are met.
• Process Improvement: Streamline trading and order management processes, identifying areas for improvement and creating on-desk tools when necessary.
• Daily Trade Bookings: Ensure accurate capture of all risks and P&L through daily trade bookings.
• Market Analysis: Conduct weekly analysis of client trading behavior, market news, and new trading ideas.
• Technology Development: Work with our technology team to build a swap order management system.
Requirements:
• Educational Background: University degree in Business, Finance, or related field.
• Industry Experience: 3-5 years of experience in Synthetic Swap trading roles in Asian markets.
• Product Expertise: End-to-end knowledge and expertise in Delta One products; ETFs, Equity Swaps, Futures. Equity Finance products knowledge is beneficial.
• Business Acumen: Deep understanding of the prime brokerage business, client onboarding, trade capture, portfolio margining, risk monitoring, etc.
• Personal Qualities: Attention to detail, ability to work under stress, excellent organizational and leadership skills, highly motivated with a positive attitude, and ability to multi-task.
• Technical Skills: Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, VBA/Python.
• Languages: Fluency in English, Cantonese, and Mandarin.

This role is suitable for an individual with a mid-senior level of experience, seeking a challenging opportunity in a dynamic environment. The ideal candidate will be a team player, possessing excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package to the successful candidate. If you are a motivated and results-driven professional, please submit your application, including a resume and expected salary, quoting the job reference.

They are actively engaged in trading equities, futures & options on listed exchanges. Primarily the firm takes a systematic approach, using quantitative strategies to invest, but can also consider quantamental investors too. The company can offer a highly competitive profit-share, with other benefits available to high performing traders. Preference is for medium frequency strategies with holding periods from minutes to days. An excellent opportunity to continue your trading career in an environment where you will compensated in line with your performance. Candidates must have prior experience on the buy side at either hedge funds, prop trading firms, or family offices. Relocation can be provided for a successful candidate.

title: Rare Metals Trader (Listed Company, 50K)
description:

• Oversee end-to-end supply chain processes to ensure timely delivery, quality assurance, and optimal quantity management.
• Collaborate with logistics, warehousing, and transportation teams to streamline operations and reduce costs. Implement risk mitigation strategies, including client payment follow-ups, currency fluctuation management, and default prevention

Requirements:

• Bachelor's degree or higher (full-time education).
• Expertise in full-cycle import/export operations and Hong Kong offshore trading practices.
• Business-level English proficiency for negotiations and professional correspondence.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess market trends independently.
• Established network of reliable suppliers and clients preferred.
• Experience in futures trading is a plus.

title: HK Single Stock Options Market Making Trader
description:
Senior Market Making Trader for Hong Kong Single Stock Options

We seek a highly skilled Senior Market Making Trader to join our team at Principle Partners, specializing in systematic trading and quantitative strategies for single stock options in the Hong Kong market.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop and execute advanced market making strategies for Hong Kong single stock options, leveraging technology-driven systems and quantitative models.
• Analyze market data and microstructure to optimize pricing, hedging, and risk management, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
• Leverage expertise in quantitative strategy development to enhance trading decisions and improve profitability, maximizing stamp duty savings and rebates.
• Engage in off-screen trading to facilitate large orders and maintain liquidity, utilizing low-latency systems and algorithmic trading platforms.
• Collaborate with quants and engineers to integrate advanced technology into trading systems, continuously improving trading algorithms and execution systems.
• Monitor and manage risk exposure, optimizing trading strategies to minimize losses and maximize returns.
• Participate in the development of cutting-edge trading solutions, working closely with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and growth.

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering).
• 4–5 years of senior-level experience in market making, preferably in Hong Kong single stock options, with a strong understanding of Hong Kong market microstructure.
• Proven expertise in systematic trading, quantitative strategy development, and trading technology, including proficiency in programming languages (e.g., Python, C++).
• Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment, and strong communication skills for collaboration with traders, quants, and technology teams.
• Familiarity with investment management and financial services, with a passion for staying up-to-date with industry trends and developments.

About Principle Partners

We are a leading global hedge fund focused on delivering exceptional returns through innovative trading strategies and cutting-edge technology. Our team is dedicated to fostering a collaborative and dynamic work environment that encourages growth, learning, and success.

What We Offer

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, opportunities for professional growth and development, and a dynamic work environment that supports creativity, innovation, and teamwork.

title: Equity Warrant Trading, Quantitative Trader - Analyst/Associate
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Are you ready to take your career to the next level in a fast-paced trading environment? At JPMorgan Chase, we offer an exciting opportunity to work alongside industry leaders, making markets for a range of listed products in Asian exchanges. Your expertise will help shape the future of our trading desk, driving innovation and efficiency in risk management.

As an Analyst/Associate in our Equity Warrant Trading team, you will collaborate with senior traders to make markets for a range of listed products in Asian exchanges. You will assist in managing risk, liquidity, and exposure, and support all aspects of the trading desk, including trade and P&L analytics, algorithms/strategies development, and system enhancements. Additionally, you will analyze market dynamics to improve the efficiency of risk management.

Job Responsibilities:
• Perform data analysis and program strategies to enhance our market making system
• Partner with the Technology/Quant research team to enhance and automate existing tools and systems.
• Coordinate with control functions to ensure proper controls are in place.
• Engage in team meetings and business management to drive and deliver results.
• Ensure that all activities and duties are carried out in full compliance with regulatory requirements, firm-wide risk framework, and internal policies.
• Collaborate with senior stakeholders to effectively market make, and risk manage the portfolio.
• Work closely with the Sales team to drive the business forward.

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• 2-5 years relevant experiences in equity derivatives trading or electronic market making.
• Strong awareness of market structure changes and the impact of regulation.
• Proficient in Python and C++ programming languages.
• Extensive knowledge in data science.
• Experience working collaboratively in highly productive teams.
• High degree of numeracy.
• Strong communication skills, especially around complicated concepts.
• Works thoughtfully and logically.
• Strong and clear communicator.
• Motivated to learn and proactively seeks responsibility.
• Able to work in a pressured environment; tenacious and self-motivated.

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• Advanced degree in quantitative subjects like Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, etc.
• Experience with algorithmic trading strategies.
• Familiarity with Asian financial markets and regulations.

ABOUT US

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

ABOUT THE TEAM

J.P. Morgan’s Commercial & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets, securities services and payments. Corporations, governments and institutions throughout the world entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. The Commercial & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.

title: 高級交易員
location: Central And Western District, Hong Kong
description:
Senior Options Arbitrage Trader

Key Responsibilities
• Design, execute, and manage delta-neutral, directional, and volatility arbitrage strategies in both crypto and traditional options markets.
• Trade across centralized crypto options venues (e.g., Deribit, OKX, Binance), traditional exchanges (e.g., CME, Eurex), and OTC.
• Monitor risk exposures, margin, Greeks, and volatility surfaces in real time.
• Identify pricing inefficiencies and market structure edge across spot/futures/options combinations.
• Collaborate with quant researchers and developers to refine models, backtests, and trading systems.

Requirements
• 10+ years of experience in options trading or derivatives structuring, ideally with exposure to both traditional and crypto markets.
• Strong understanding of options pricing models (Black-Scholes, local vol, stochastic vol), volatility surfaces, and Greeks.
• Proven track record of running live options strategies with real PnL responsibility.
• Familiarity with trading platforms such as Deribit, CME, Bloomberg, or institutional crypto trading stacks.
• Comfortable working in fast-moving, high-volatility environments with complex product structures.
• Deep understanding of risk management, capital deployment, and operational best practices.
• Excellent communication skills and ability to interface with tech, ops, and risk teams.
• Entrepreneurial mindset with a hands-on, ownership-driven attitude.

description:

title: RO/Trader/PM/IR Manager/EAM
description:
About Us

We are a pioneering asset management firm seeking a highly skilled and ambitious individual to join our team as a Senior Equity Trader. At Macrowaters Asia Fund Management Limited, we pride ourselves on our innovative approach to investment management, focusing on delivering consistent risk-adjusted returns for our clients.
Job Description

The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating 'consistent' risk-adjusted returns for clients of 8-15% net p.a., implementing a strong risk management strategy, managing and growing client base, communicating market updates, and conducting research on new market ideas. They will also assist in other aspects of the business and maintain good teamwork with the firm's culture of innovation, transparency, and dedication.
Key Responsibilities:
• Create 'consistent' risk-adjusted returns for clients of 8-15% net p.a (not super high but volatile returns)
• Implement a strong risk management 'low risk-low vol' strategy
• Manage and grow client base of Asian/global institutions, listed companies, UHNWI, non-profit etc
• Communicate to client ideas and market updates with strong conviction i.e Hedge fund, ESG, AI
• Do research on new market ideas or work with the research team
• Able to help manage client portfolio in bull and bear markets (run net long or net short portfolios)
• Flexible and adapt fast to suit evolving market/economic conditions
• Adapt and learn fast in US, European and Asian markets (at times US time zone may be needed)
• Use excellent risk management skills to limit losses and preserve capital
• Execute a mid-long term strategic growth plan to outperform the market i.e seek alpha returns
Requirements

To succeed in this role, you will need to possess a degree/diploma in business/economics/marketing/finance/liberal arts and have at least 2 years of experience in fund management, trading, private banking, IR, or a related field. You should also hold an SFC type 9 license representative in Hong Kong or equivalent and have multi-asset and multi-strategy experience, preferably in discretionary or quantitative hedging. Strong communication and networking skills, along with the ability to speak Chinese and other foreign languages, are essential.
What We Offer

We offer a competitive total package that includes a performance-driven compensation model, high degree of autonomy and discretion in managing funds, and opportunities for exponential growth with institutional investors. You will also have access to in-house training and development programs, and may be offered a minority equity holder opportunity to grow your own business. Our firm values creativity, independence, and passion, and offers a flat meritocratic system where talented individuals can progress quickly based on results.

Able to think critically and make sound judgments, you will be responsible for staying up-to-date with market developments and adjusting your strategies accordingly. Your attention to detail and commitment to excellence will be crucial in ensuring the success of our trading operations.

In return for your hard work and dedication, we offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for professional growth and development within our organization.

If you are a motivated and ambitious individual with a passion for trading and finance, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to join our team at Wellesley Partners Ltd.

title: Senior Quantitative Trader (Cash OTC)
description:
Who We Are

At OKX, we believe that the future will be reshaped by crypto, and ultimately contribute to every individual's freedom.

OKX is a leading crypto exchange, and the developer of OKX Wallet, giving millions access to crypto trading and decentralized crypto applications (dApps). OKX is also a trusted brand by hundreds of large institutions seeking access to crypto markets. We are safe and reliable, backed by our Proof of Reserves.

Across our multiple offices globally, we are united by our core principles: We Before Me , Do the Right Thing , and Get Things Done . These shared values drive our culture, shape our processes, and foster a friendly, rewarding, and diverse environment for every OK-er.

OKX is part of OKG, a group that brings the value of Blockchain to users around the world, through our leading products OKX, OKX Wallet, OKLink and more.

About the Opportunity

What You’ll Be Doing
• Trade execution.
• Help with systematic RFQ quoting system enhancement design.
• FX exposure management.
• Work with developers to build and drive the continual improvement of the world-class risk management and trading tools.

What We Look For In You
• Degree in a relevant area (Mathematics/Physics/Engineering/Computer Science/Finance) from a top university.
• Fluent Chinese and English communication skill.
• Deep understanding of Delta 1 products and basic knowledge of the cryptocurrency product is a plus.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and make rational decisions under pressure.

What We Offer
• World-class connections to major cryptocurrency exchanges and ultra-low latency trading system.
• User friendly strategy containers enable very easy and fast implementation, backtesting, and deployment of trading strategies.
• Top notch quant development team providing support in state-of-the-art infrastructure, robust strategy implementations, and data service.
• A chance to work and exchange ideas with brilliant ex-banking/ex-fund traders from various backgrounds.
• Very competitive remuneration package structure.

Perks & Benefits
• Competitive total compensation package
• L&D programs and Education subsidy for employees' growth and development
• Various team building programs and company events
• Wellness and meal allowances
• Comprehensive healthcare schemes for employees and dependants
• More that we love to tell you along the process!
