title: Trader Support APAC - 10192
description:
The Role

The Hong Kong Service Desk provides Fidessa’s first line support service to customers and forms part of Fidessa’s global support team. The desk is responsible for providing both on-site and remote support to users and trading support personnel, maintaining a strong relationship with clients as well as developing a deep understanding of client systems and business practices.

Key Responsibilities
• Analyses each call, using business acumen to identify the nature of the incident and action appropriately
• Deals with calls immediately, either independently or by passing to the appropriate team to ensure optimum resolution
• Attends client site to assist with issue resolution and increase business knowledge where requested
• Participates in the team shift patterns and assists with weekend work and out of hours escalation when required
• Develops strong working relationships with other departments to assist with the delivery of our service to clients. Adheres to "best practice" and department procedures for client communications, incident progression and investigation

Required Skills, Qualifications And Experience
• First-hand experience of supporting trading systems in a production environment
• Have an enquiring mind with an analytical and proactive approach to problem solving, even when under pressure. Able to view situations from a customer perspective and act accordingly
• Service desk analysts need to be dynamic, resilient and objective, delivering rapid and accurate solutions to the incidents raised by customers
• First class English written and verbal communication skills, fluency in Cantonese/Mandarin
• A strong desire to develop a deep understanding of financial markets and business flows and Fidessa's functionality

About Us

We’re a diverse group of visionary innovators who provide trading and workflow automation software, high-value analytics, and strategic consulting to corporations, central banks, financial institutions, and governments. Founded in 1999, we’ve achieved tremendous growth by bringing together some of the best and most successful financial technology companies in the world.

Over 2,000 of the world’s leading corporations, including 50% of the Fortune 500 and 30% of the world’s central banks, trust ION solutions to manage their cash, in-house banking, commodity supply chain, trading and risk.

Over 800 of the world’s leading banks and broker-dealers use our electronic trading platforms to operate the world’s financial market infrastructure.

ION is a rapidly expanding and dynamic group with 13,000 employees and offices in more than 40 cities around the globe.

Our ever-expanding global footprint, cutting edge products, and over 40,000 customers worldwide provide an unparalleled career experience for those who share our vision.

All applications applied through our system will be delivered directly to the advertiser and privacy of personal data of the applicant will be ensured with security.

title: ASSO/AVP, Trader, Fixed Income Department
RO/Trader/PM/IR Manager/EAM
description:
Why? That's the key question. Even more important now as Trump global trade wars are raging.

'It's not the plane, but the pilot' Top Gun 2. If you 'Think Different', look far ahead and believe in being adaptable, this may be the place for you. Successful disruptors believe: It's the "fight" in the dog not the "size" of the dog that matters.

The long run upside is exponential while downside is limited. No free lunch in the world, time is limited, pursue your passion and be handsomely rewarded, not just monetary wise but also get a sense of total achievement - express your creative ideas and be fairly rewarded with a great performance bonus.

This is a SFC Type 9 licensed Asset Management RO role but we can consider those from discretionary private client accounts with min. 2 years experience in fund management, family office, private banking, PE or IR experience.

Our focus is on getting the "Job to be done" for investors - a truly challenging & rewarding task to attain 'consistent lower risk' long-term performance via innovation and agility.

Strive to be best of best, don't take orders from top with little common sense for clients or integrity of the job: someone thinks like a scientist, doctor, architect but act with unbridled creativity like an artist, designer, musician - "Art + Science doer".

Humble and hungry for success yet take failure with stride to rise above it all for yourself & for team and for clients, always. Customer-centric is what makes firms great not making top dollar for the firm first.

Not the What. Those looking for a high 'basic pay' job like big brand names instead of "performance driven" compensation - Do Not Apply. (We seek talents in the 5% not the 95% majority.)

Willing to be contrarian and challenge the status quo. Warren Buffett said once about Benjamin Graham his guru – ‘he believed that the markets are wrong’ – this totally run contrary to what many market analysts or economists believe the market is priced in and cannot make excess gain (efficient market hypothesis). Macro hedge fund managers like George Soros & Jim Rogers also held the same view and Sir John Templeton a value investor was agile to short-sell tech stocks when 2000 dotcom bubble burst going against Wall St consensus.

Thus, we seek someone HIP, 'unconventional / rebel' from an organization with courage to seek a refreshing change. High confidence, don't accept no for an answer to get the best results for clients; challenge the status quo, good knowledge of financial markets (always learning & questioning) and courage & perspective to be a pragmatic risk-taker. An 'artisan' that never gives up.

If you can bring value to the table - with both skills and "network", let's talk for larger "total package - including % performance bonus" that can be 2x bonus of big firms.

Yes, we seek "hidden gems" that may or may not have 'Ivy League or pedigree backgrounds or connections', but a strong desire to work hard & innovate to win, even stronger desire to stand up after falling. Even the underdog can do well if given a chance. The sky is the limit if you truly believe in resilience.

Resourceful with a good network of existing corporate/HNWI clients (a plus) or know how to find & build. A strategic mindset to drive the future success of the client and our firm under one vision. The ability to persuade adoption of new ideas to capture emerging trends i.e ESG / Sustainability is "in the investment process" as climate change

For junior roles, please email your CV, basic pay & why/how you can add value to: [via CTgoodjobs Apply Now]

Rewards
• The total package is of high personal enrichment for the suitable candidate over time
• Getting licensed in HK as SFC type 9 (Asset Management) representative or RO (depends on experience) and potentially U.S and Cayman - highly transferable skills to institutional pension or large asset managers
• Highest "profit-sharing/performance bonus" model in the industry with a transparent formula, high degree of autonomy and discretion in managing funds with an 'own business' mindset.
• Potential exponential growth with institutional investors in future after 2-3 years track record
• We are able to value add to candidates with the desire to improve and learn with our in-house training
• Suitable candidates may be offered an unprecedented chance to be a minority equity holder to grow
• Fast progress based on results: build your own team in future - direct that business in a flat meritocratic system
• Work hours may be 'partially flexible' as we stress "quality over quantity" - "great ideas over stale copycat ideas" & tactically executing the "best work at the right time-right place").
• Chance to collaborate in future fintech and social innovation/ESG/IPO bespoke projects
• Sponsorship of future courses and travel relevant to the job

Responsibilities
• Create 'consistent' risk-adjusted returns for clients of 8-15% net p.a (not super high but volatile returns)
• Implement a strong risk management 'low risk-low vol' strategy
• Manage and grow client base of Asian/global institutions, listed companies, UHNWI, non-profit etc
• Communicate to client ideas and market updates with strong conviction i.e Hedge fund, ESG, AI
• Do research on new market ideas or work with the research team
• Able to help manage client portfolio in bull and bear markets (run net long or net short portfolios)
• Flexible and adapt fast to suit evolving market/economic conditions
• Adapt and learn fast in US, European and Asian markets (at times US time zone may be needed)
• Use excellent risk management skills to limit losses and preserve capital
• Execute a mid-long term strategic growth plan to outperform the market i.e seek alpha returns
• Maintain good teamwork with the firm's culture of innovation, transparency and dedication (Core Values: HIP-AIR)
• Look at P&L and forecast financial metrics as performance matters to clients
• Understand basic international compliance rules & regulations
• Assist in other aspects of the business

Qualifications
• Degree/Diploma with business/economics/marketing/finance/liberal arts (preferred)
• Fund Management Traders/PM, analysts, private bankers, IR managers, family office strategists, luxury advisors
• SFC type 9 license representative in Hong Kong or equivalent (preferred)
• Finance or high end segment marketing experience of min 2 years
• Multi-asset and multi-strategy (discretionary or quantitative)/hedging experience preferred
• Successful fundraising experience with high end clients (UHNW and institutions) a plus
• Proven skills in acquiring new clients and building strong relationships
• Strong communication and networking skillsets that transcends nationalities
• "Creative DOers" & independent thinkers - 'Art & Science' practitioners
• A genuine passion to succeed in alternative investment management
• Highly passionate & optimistic to be succeed but also humble enough to rectify errors
• Ability to speak Chinese essential and other foreign languages Japanese Korean French German etc

All applications applied through our system will be delivered directly to the advertiser and privacy of personal data of the applicant will be ensured with security.

description:

title: Cryptocurrency Trader(加密货币交易员)
description:
Responsibilities：
• Reporting to the Head of Proprietary Investment Business Division, accountable for executing cryptocurrency product trading orders. Through strategic implementation and robust risk governance, ensuring zero operational risks and optimizing profit maximization.
• Conduct real-time monitoring of order book depth and market dynamics across leading exchanges (e.g., Binance/OKX/Bybit), adeptly identifying trading opportunities and seizing optimal execution price windows.
• Collaborate with the proprietary trading team to execute trading mandates, track and evaluate strategy performance, and provide slippage analytics for strategic recalibration and iterative enhancement.
• Generate periodic trading execution quality reports, incorporating key performance indicators (KPIs) such as Fill Rate and Slippage.
• Deliver data-driven, actionable trading recommendations and solutions through in-depth analytical modelling.
• Maintain vigilant tracking of cutting-edge market developments, trends, and news updates.

Requirements：
• A bachelor’s degree or higher in STEM disciplines (Mathematics, Financial Engineering, Computer Science, etc.). Preference for graduates from Hong Kong’s top three universities (HKU/HKUST/CUHK) or global QS Top 100 institutions.
• Preferably 2+ years of cryptocurrency trading execution experience (requiring submission of historical order book records). Proficient in exchange products, trading protocols, order types, and mainstream trading platforms. Expertise in financial analysis tools (e.g., Bloomberg, Excel, Python, etc.).
• Work experience at leading Hong Kong-based cryptocurrency exchanges or digital asset quantitative funds. Priority for candidates with algorithmic trading, quantitative analysis experience, or tenure at licensed Hong Kong financial institutions.
• Possess extensive industry resources and networks in the cryptocurrency sector, with profound market insights and critical thinking.
• Demonstrate acute market sensitivity, coupled with robust analytical and forecasting acumen.
• Capable of making sound decisions and managing high-pressure scenarios in fast-paced trading environments.
• Fluent in English, Chinese (including Cantonese and Mandarin), with strong communication and presentation skills.

岗位核心职责：
• 向自营投资业务部负责人汇报，负责加密货币产品交易订单的执行，通过执行交易策略和风险把控，实现零操作风险和利益最大化
• 实时追踪Binance/OKX/Bybit等主流交易所深度和市场发展，准确识别交易机会，捕捉最佳执行价格窗口
• 与自营团队配合执行交易指令，追踪和评估交易策略的表现，反馈滑点数据供策略调整和迭代
• 定期生成交易执行质量报告（包含Fill Rate、Slippage滑价等KPI）
• 通过数据分析来提供深入可行的交易建议和方案
• 保持对市场最新发展和趋势、新闻等的高度关注和追踪

任职资格要求：
• 数学/金融工程/计算机等STEM专业本科及以上学历，毕业于香港三大（HKU/HKUST/CUHK）或全球QS Top100院校为佳
• 有2-3年以上加密货币交易执行经验（需提供历史订单簿记录样本）为佳，熟悉交易所各类产品和交易规则。精通订单类型及主流交易平台，熟练使用金融分析工具和软件（如Bloomberg，Excel，Python等）
• 有在香港排名领先的加密货币交易平台或数字货币量化基金工作经历；有算法交易和量化分析的经验、或在香港持牌金融机构工作经验的优先考虑
• 具备丰富的加密货币行业资源和人脉，对加密货币市场有深入的了解和思考
• 对市场变化高度敏感，有良好的市场分析和预测能力
• 能够在快节奏的交易环境中做出决策并有效应对压力
• 英文和中文（包括粤语和普通话）流利，有较强的沟通和表达能力

title: Vice President / Director, Equity Derivatives – Option Trader for India and Systematic Strategies, Global Equities, Hong Kong
description:
Job Description:

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. We do this by driving Responsible Growth and delivering for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.

Being a Great Place to Work is core to how we drive Responsible Growth. This includes our commitment to being an inclusive workplace, attracting and developing exceptional talent, supporting our teammates’ physical, emotional, and financial wellness, recognizing and rewarding performance, and how we make an impact in the communities we serve.

Bank of America is committed to an in-office culture with specific requirements for office-based attendance and which allows for an appropriate level of flexibility for our teammates and businesses based on role-specific considerations.

At Bank of America, you can build a successful career with opportunities to learn, grow, and make an impact. Join us!

Job Description:

Our APAC Equity Derivatives business is looking to hire a Senior Option Trader for India and Systematic Strategies to join the team in Hong Kong. Ideal candidates will have relevant experience in equity derivatives trading desk and able to demonstrate strong quantitative skills and solid knowledge.

Responsibilities:
• The role is responsible for managing risk and developing trading activities with limited direction from senior staff. Daily responsibilities will include pricing, hedging, trading, booking, reporting risk and P&L.
• Proactively maintaining and building client relationships, supporting clients with buying and selling financial products, and implementing trading strategies to achieve revenue goals.
• Having in-depth knowledge of risk management, hedging, and trading strategies as well as market characteristics.
• Partners with sales teams to help the bank's clients execute trading activities, while sharing knowledge of the current market environment.
• Performs trading activities in compliance with regulations, industry standards, and other requirements and ensures trading orders are executed with the highest degree of accuracy and time efficiency.
• Assigns accounts to pre-defined trading models and administers trades based on product guidelines.
• Operates as a market maker, buying and selling financial instruments in accordance with established trading strategies and risk parameters.

Requirements:
• Minimum 6-8 years of relevant experience in equity derivatives option trading for India market and systematic strategies.
• Solid knowledge and understanding of equities products, markets dynamics and risk management.
• Strong programming (Python) skills, analytical and data skills.
• Aptitude to work well under fast paced environment.
• Excellent communication skills, reasoning and problem solving.

Skills:
• Trading
• Trade Monitoring
• Trading and Investment Analysis
• Trading Strategy
• Business Acumen
• Risk Management
• Client Management

title: Tier 1 Hedge Fund Execution Quantitative Trader Singapore
description:
Job Title: Recruitment Consultant - Quant
Selby Jennings is seeking a highly skilled and motivated individual to join our team as a Recruitment Consultant in the Quantitative Finance space.
Key Responsibilities:
• Develop and optimize execution algorithms to minimize market impact and transaction costs, driving efficiency and profitability in trading operations.
• Monitor and enhance trading performance through real-time analytics and post-trade analysis, providing actionable insights for strategic decision-making.
• Collaborate with researchers and engineers to integrate execution models into the trading infrastructure, ensuring seamless integration and maximum benefit from cutting-edge technologies.
• Analyze market microstructure and liquidity dynamics to refine trading strategies, staying ahead of market trends and fluctuations.
• Implement and test smart order routing and adaptive execution strategies across multiple asset classes, capitalizing on emerging opportunities and mitigating risks.
• Utilize statistical modeling and machine learning techniques to improve execution efficiency, continuously refining and optimizing processes to achieve exceptional results.
• Work closely with compliance and risk teams to ensure regulatory adherence and risk mitigation, maintaining the highest standards of integrity and responsibility.
• Stay informed on market structure changes and technology advancements to maintain a competitive edge, proactively adapting to shifting landscapes and seizing new opportunities.

Qualifications:
• Demonstrate strong programming skills in Python, C++, or kdb+/Q, with a proven ability to develop and implement high-quality code.

Selby Jennings offers a dynamic and supportive work environment, with opportunities for growth and development. If you are a motivated and talented individual looking to make a meaningful contribution in the field of quantitative finance, we encourage you to apply.

title: Systematic Trader (Proprietary LLM/AI) – Dubai | Lead & Build | Tax-Free
description:
At RGG Capital, we are seeking an experienced Systematic Trader (5+ years) to spearhead the development and execution of quantitative strategies within a new, dedicated trading function at RGG Capital HQ in Dubai. This role offers a unique opportunity to lead, innovate with proprietary AI, and build a significant trading operation backed by patient, long-term capital. Learn more about us: https://rgg.capital/

Reporting directly to the CEO and leading a Quantitative Analyst, you will be instrumental in deploying high-frequency, event-driven trading strategies across commodities and equities. Your core analytical advantage will be unique alpha signals generated from our proprietary Large Language Model (LLM) technology.

Why This Role Presents a Unique Opportunity:
• Define the Edge with Proprietary LLM: Collaborate directly with our AI/ML research team to refine, iterate, and enhance the alpha-generating capabilities of our unique LLM. Your insights will be critical in shaping our technological and trading advantage.
• Build, Lead & Scale with Impact: Assume responsibility for an initial $10M+ book with a clear framework for capital scaling based on performance. Lead a Quantitative Analyst and directly influence the architecture and growth of our systematic trading capability.
• Direct CEO Access & Focused Operational Environment: Benefit from direct strategic alignment with our CEO within a discreet, focused environment conducive to rigorous quantitative work, free from common external fund management pressures.
• Exceptional Tax-Free Rewards & Comprehensive Relocation: Competitive Salary: AED 50,000 - AED 65,000 per month (tax-free), complemented by a performance bonus structure (e.g., directly linked to P&L – details provided to qualified candidates). Full Relocation to Dubai: Including flights, visa sponsorship, and initial accommodation.
• Cutting-Edge Infrastructure & Resources: Operate within an agile setup with access to high-performance computing, sophisticated analytical tools, and the necessary resources for deploying and optimizing low-latency strategies.

Key Responsibilities & Strategic Objectives:
• Strategy & Alpha Generation: Translate LLM-derived signals into robust, profitable trading strategies; continuously research and implement enhancements to alpha and execution quality.
• Portfolio & Risk Management: Manage and scale a $10M+ systematic portfolio, implementing and refining advanced risk controls appropriate for HFT environments.
• Algorithm Optimization: Drive the evolution of trading algorithms to minimize transaction costs (slippage, latency) and maximize performance.
• LLM Feedback & Iteration: Provide critical, data-driven feedback to the AI/ML team to systematically improve the LLM's predictive accuracy and signal efficacy.
• Team Leadership & Development: Mentor and guide a Quantitative Analyst, fostering a culture of rigorous research, quantitative discipline, and high performance.

Candidate Profile: Qualifications & Experience:

Required:
• Minimum 5 years of experience as a Systematic Trader with a verifiable track record of P&L generation in commodities and/or equities.
• Deep expertise in quantitative technical analysis and the full lifecycle of algorithmic trading (HFT/low-latency development, backtesting, deployment, and optimization).
• Demonstrated experience managing and scaling systematic trading portfolios of $10M+ with sophisticated risk management frameworks.
• Advanced proficiency in Python, R, or a similar language for quantitative research, advanced backtesting, and algorithm development.
• Expertise in real-time risk monitoring, mitigation techniques, and statistical performance analysis for systematic strategies.
• Strong capability to collaborate effectively with, and provide precise, actionable insights to, AI/ML research teams.

Preferred:
• Experience in building or significantly scaling a systematic trading desk or a new suite of strategies.
• Direct market microstructure knowledge in energy, agriculture, or specific large-cap equity markets.
• Master’s or PhD in a relevant quantitative field (e.g., Financial Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science).

Our Commitment: Skills-First, Transparent Hiring Process:

We value demonstrable expertise. Our recruitment process is designed to be efficient, objective, and fair, commencing with a Phase 1 online assessment that allows candidates to showcase their practical skills. This enables us to identify highly capable individuals effectively.

Opportunity to Build a Leading AI-Driven Trading Operation:

If you are a results-oriented systematic trader with a strong interest in making a foundational impact within a well-capitalized, technologically advanced, and innovative trading environment, we encourage you to apply.

If your expertise aligns with this unique opportunity to lead and innovate with proprietary AI in a dynamic Dubai setting, we encourage you to take the next step.

Click "Apply" to submit your profile and participate in our skills-based Phase 1 assessment.

All applications applied through our system will be delivered directly to the advertiser and privacy of personal data of the applicant will be ensured with security.

title: Senior Quant Risk Manager (Derivatives)
description:
My client, a leading financial institution, is expanding its Hong Kong team and seeking an experienced Quant with a solid derivatives background. Reporting the Head of Quant Risk you will be responsible for the following:

Responsibilities
• Work in close collaboration with risk management units on quant risk methodology projects and initiatives, liaising with model validation teams to identify issues in risk models and propose enhancements.

title: Linux Systems Engineer
description:
Flow Traders is looking for an experienced Linux Systems Engineer to join our growing Technology team in Hong Kong. The ideal candidate possesses a great sense of ownership and passion for working with the latest technologies. This is a unique opportunity to join a leading proprietary trading firm with an entrepreneurial and innovative culture at the heart of its business. We value quick-witted, creative minds and challenge them to make full use of their capacities. If you aim high, the sky is the limit!

The incumbent’s primary responsibility will be to build, improve, and maintain our complex Linux environment. They will work closely with other systems engineering teams (Windows, Database, Storage, VMware) to further develop a coherent and robust infrastructure.

They will work closely with the Trading Operations and Global Systems teams to ensure that we support and scale the low latency trading systems that support our business.

What You Will Do
• Administer, upgrade, and improve the server/workstation configurations using a centralised management platform
• Provide regular day to day operational support for Linux systems in the APAC region and support our global Linux deployment during APAC operating hours in a ‘follow-the-sun’ model
• Design, install and administer the Linux platform to support stream and batch processing workflows and ETL reporting infrastructure
• Collaborate with Development and other IT teams to provision environments for new projects
• Automate deployments and implement innovative improvements to continually improve our operating environment
• Develop new solutions through research and development projects
• Stay on top of new technologies and suggest/implement improvements to our technology stack
• Work closely with other global Technology teams to ensure reliability and scalability of our infrastructure

What You Need to Succeed
• Minimum 3 years of relevant work experience in a similar role
• BSc in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field
• Strong knowledge of Enterprise Linux distributions and networking (e.g. DNS, DHCP, routing/switching, multicast)
• Hands-on experience with configuration management tools (e.g. Foreman/Puppet, Ansible)
• Working knowledge in heterogeneous environments is advantageous (e.g Active Directory integration)
• Solid understanding of storage, load balancing, server hardware
• Proficiency with version control systems (preferably git)
• Scripting skills in Python or Bash
• Strong troubleshooting and analytical skillset with a focus on attention to detail
• Slef-driven and the ability to work under pressure and possess a strong work ethic

title: Inventory Management Trader, Capital Markets Financing
description:
Inventory Management Trader

Savvy about managing risk and driven to excel? We're looking for someone like you to join our Capital Markets Financing team at UBS.

Your role involves generating revenue, growing client business, and liaising with sales/clients on market movements.
• Generate revenue and grow client business, liaise with sales/clients on market movements
• Proactively keep on top of market developments and trading opportunities
• Build analytical tools focused on optimizing funding markets across OTC and listed liquidity pools
• Identify potential trading strategies and suggest ideas to improve existing methods
• Adapt to changing regulatory environments and follow internal policies, including quality of execution, pricing, hedging, trading limits, and compliance
About Your Role

You'll be working in the CMF Inventory Management team based in Hong Kong, responsible for risk management of a trading book, pricing and executing client orders in all Delta-One derivative products, and maintaining and optimizing hedges to maximize revenue and balance sheet returns.
Your Expertise
• Bachelor's degree plus at least 5 years' relevant experience
• Keen long-term interest in markets and financial risk management
• Strong analytical skills, including analysis of intraday stock and market patterns
• Deep knowledge of listed and OTC equity derivatives, with understanding of APAC market structures and regulations
• Ability to work effectively as part of a team in a demanding environment
• Mandarin proficiency is highly preferred due to interaction with Greater China clients
About Us

We offer expert advice, wealth management, investment banking, asset management, retail banking in Switzerland, and support functions worldwide. With about 60,000 employees across over 50 countries, we serve private and institutional clients and corporations globally.
Career Development and Diversity

We are a diverse, inclusive, and collaborative team committed to your career development, internal mobility, and work-life balance. We welcome applications from career returners and value diversity in all its forms.

title: Senior Money Market Trader, Global Markets
description:
Senior Money Market Trader, Global Markets

Supervise the Money Market Desk and responsible for money market deal executions.
• Manage liquidity and interest rate risk for Cathay United Bank and ensure all key risk indicators are in compliance with internal limits and fulfill regulatory requirements.
• Participate in interest rate related trading activities including money market, fixed income products, FX swaps, and interest rate swaps.
• Perform interbank lending/borrowing, FX swap & interest rate derivative transactions dynamically in accordance with the bank's asset-liability position.
• Advise strategies to reduce funding costs and increase revenue from asset and liability management.
• Provide competitive rates and market information to other business units.
• Participate in ad hoc assignments and prepare monthly reporting to senior management.

Job Requirements:
• Degree holder in Finance, Economics, Business, or relevant disciplines preferred.
• At least 7 years of relevant experience with a trading track record.
• Solid product knowledge and understanding of relevant OTC derivatives regulatory framework.
• Holder of HKSFC Type 1 license.
• Performance driven and able to work under pressure.
• Strong analytical skills.
• Proficient in written and spoken English and Chinese (Mandarin and Cantonese).
Job Summary

This is a mid-senior level role within the Global Markets team at Cathay United Bank. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the Money Market Desk and overseeing various financial operations.
About the Role

The Senior Money Market Trader will be responsible for:
• Managing liquidity and interest rate risk across the bank.
• Participating in interest rate related trading activities.
• Performing interbank lending/borrowing and derivative transactions.
• Advising on strategies to reduce funding costs and increase revenue.
• Providing market information to other business units.
Requirements

To be considered for this role, you will need:
• A degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or a relevant discipline.
• At least 7 years of relevant experience with a trading track record.
• Sound knowledge of OTC derivatives and regulatory frameworks.
• A valid HKSFC Type 1 license.
• Strong analytical and communication skills.

title: Senior Execution Quant, Institutional Equities
description:
Position Description

The Algorithmic Trading team is looking for an Execution Quant to join our Hong Kong development centre.

Working closely with the algo development team, the algo quant team researches, designs and implements trading signals, trading strategies and analytics systems that are used by our traders and clients around the world. It collaborates with our electronic execution desk to promote the product it builds. It provides extensive quantitative client services to our client base.

We strive for innovation and a quantitative, data-driven approach to trading.

Our culture is collaborative and one where everyone is valued and given the opportunity to make an impact.

Key Areas of Responsibilities

The successful candidate
• will have a solid experience in building and evaluating equities execution strategies
• will have a strong understanding of drivers of execution performance across Asia
• will carry out custom client-driven execution research, provide quantitative advisory services to our clients, optimise our algo wheel configurations and data mine our trading exhaust as well as contribute to the development and improvement of the electronic trading strategies across the full development cycle

• Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
• Demonstrated practical experience or deep understanding of statistical and machine learning techniques
• Strong programming skills and proficiency in Python.

• Strong communication and interpersonal skills
• Strong team player and open to new ideas
• Understanding of equity market microstructure
• Experience building execution models and trading strategies
• Ability to code in q/kdb+
• Development experience in C# or other object oriented programming languages

title: Off-Cycle Quantitative Trading Intern

description:

title: Intern, Quantitative Analyst (June to September)
description:
Natixis Corporate & Investment Banking is a leading global financial institution that provides advisory, investment banking, financing, corporate banking and capital markets services to corporations, financial institutions, financial sponsors and sovereign and supranational organizations worldwide.

Our teams of experts in close to 30 countries advise clients on their strategic development, helping them to grow and transform their businesses, and maximize their positive impact. Natixis CIB is committed to aligning its financing portfolio with a carbon neutrality path by 2050 while helping its clients reduce the environmental impact of their business.

As part of Groupe BPCE, the second largest banking group in France through the Banque Populaire and Caisse d’Epargne retail networks, Natixis CIB benefits from the Group’s financial strength and solid financial ratings (Standard & Poor's: A+, Moody's: A1, Fitch Ratings: A+, R&I: A+).

Main Responsibilities:

You will be a member of the APAC Global Markets Quantitative Research Team, reporting to the Head of the Quantitative Research and Commando Teams. The Quantitative research Team is in charge of maintaining our pricing models, developing and providing support for our pricing libraries, and more globally improving the quantitative framework for the pre-trade and risk management tools.

As a Quantitative Analyst Intern, you will interact on a day to day basis with the Traders and with the Financial Engineers in APAC. You will work very closely, as a team, with the other Quants, Commando and Front Office IT Developers either locally or from the other locations.
• Design, implement and validate the valuation and management models for derivative products:
• Design and develop mathematical models adapted to the pricing of derivative products managed by the Front Offices.
• Comprehend and implement algorithms that digitally simulate the models.
• Integrate the models into the production library, organize and manage it and develop analysis and management applications.

Required Skills
• Currently studying to prepare a degree in quantitative field (Quantitative Finance, Math, Physics, Engineering etc
• Passionate in Quantitative Finance and effective on IT ideally in C# / C++, python
• Possess excellent communication skills, you are highly organized, able to deal with several priorities at the same time, motivated and always delivery focused.
• Team player and is able to work under the high level of stress working environment

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Flow Traders is looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to join our team and play a key role in building, maintaining, and scaling our cloud-based platform. The ideal candidate possesses a great sense of ownership and passion for working with the latest technologies. This is a unique opportunity to join a leading proprietary trading firm with an entrepreneurial and innovative culture at the heart of its business. We value quick-witted, creative minds and challenge them to make full use of their capacities. If you aim high, the sky is the limit!

In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation, reliability, and scalability of our platform infrastructure utilizing technologies like Kubernetes, Kafka, containers, and automation tools. You will work closely with other systems engineering teams (Windows, Database, Storage, VMware) to further develop a coherent and robust infrastructure.

What You Will Do
• Design, develop, and implement platform solutions utilizing containerization technologies (Docker, etc.) and container orchestration tools (Kubernetes)
• Deploy and manage cloud-native applications on the platform using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools
• Build and maintain automation tools and scripts for infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and deployments
• Implement and manage industry standard monitoring solutions to collect and analyze platform metrics for performance optimization and troubleshooting
• Integrate and manage message streaming platforms like Kafka for real-time data pipelines
• Collaborate with developers and operations teams to ensure a smooth development and deployment lifecycle
• Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in the cloud-native space and identify opportunities for improvement

What You Need to Succeed
• Proven experience working as a Platform Engineer or similar role in a DevOps environment
• In-depth knowledge of containerization technologies (Docker, etc.) and container orchestration tools (Kubernetes)
• Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or Ansible
• Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus
• Experience with automation tools (Bash scripting, Python, etc.) for infrastructure management
• Experience with monitoring tools for infrastructure and application health
• Experience with distributed systems such as Kafka, Kubernetes, Hazelcast, or hadoop a major plus
• Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
• Strong communication and collaboration skills

What We Offer

We like to think that talent grows at Flow and stays at Flow. To ensure this, we provide our employees with an extensive onboarding program, access to Flow Academy, the best working environment, the latest technology and continuous support. We go out of our way to retain the small business feeling with which we started and stimulate innovation and collaboration through teamwork and our non-hierarchical approach. We offer competitive salary, annual discretionary bonus and other fantastic perks and benefits, such as:
• Flow Academy for continuous learning and opportunities to attend domain-related conferences
• Comprehensive health insurance coverage
• In-house lounge with a bar, pool table and console games
• Daily catered breakfast and lunch with healthy snacks and drinks available throughout the day
• In-house hairdresser and massage therapist
• Personal trainers, weekly boot camps and a subsidized gym membership
• Annual company trip and a variety of events throughout the year
• Global rotations between our offices world wide
• and more!

Flow Traders does not accept unsolicited resumes from any professional staffing or search firms. All resumes, and any other information identifying potential candidates, submitted to any employee at Flow Traders via-email, the Internet or directly without a valid and signed search agreement will be deemed free to contact by Flow Traders without any restrictions and no placement fee of any kind will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Flow Traders.

title: China Commodities Fundamental Analyst
description:
About the Position

We’re looking to hire a Commodities Specialist who has deep experience in fundamentals research and familiarity with the Chinese commodities market. This position will be based out of our Hong Kong office, but will have the opportunity to travel often and collaborate with teams across our global offices.

We’re looking for someone who has experience with non-ferrous metals, iron, steel, coal, and other commodities that are disproportionately driven by the Chinese market — and is eager to hit the ground running to share and implement their ideas. You’ll work closely with traders to research and deploy strategies that will make our work stronger, and expand the firm’s trading of Chinese commodities futures in the years to come.

This role is best suited for someone who’s eager to dig deep into complex problems to find the smartest solutions. If you’ve worked in the commodities space before, you may be surprised by how much you’ll be plugged into the everyday business of the wider firm. We don’t work in siloes and our environment is overly collaborative. You’ll be able to see your fundamentals research translate directly into real trades that are made every day.

About You
• 3+ years of relevant experience in the China commodities market
• Experience executing your own code (previous experience with Python is not required, but a plus)
• Strong quantitative research skills, with the ability to turn your findings into concrete trading strategies
• Intellectually curious and eager to learn
• Enjoys helping people and solving problems
• Communicates clearly with colleagues and external partners

title: Sustainability Data Analyst
description:
Position Overview

We are seeking a talented and driven Sustainability Data Analyst based in Hong Kong to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting sustainability-related data to support our environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals. Your insights will help the company make data-driven decisions to reduce its environmental impact by identifying trends, measuring key sustainability metrics, and improving operational efficiency. Additionally, you will play a key role in aligning our sustainability initiatives with local and global standards, ensuring that we enhance our environmental strategies and achieve measurable, long-term sustainability objectives.

Key Responsibilities:
• Data Collection & Management: Gather and manage sustainability-related data, including energy consumption, waste generation, water usage, carbon emissions, and resource efficiency across various business units in Hong Kong.
• Data Analysis & Reporting: Analyze and interpret large datasets to identify key sustainability trends, insights, and areas of improvement. Prepare detailed reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
• Sustainability Metrics & KPIs: Monitor the company’s sustainability performance against established goals such as carbon reduction, energy efficiency, and waste minimization. Develop and update Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) related to sustainability.
• ESG Reporting & Compliance: Assist in preparing annual ESG reports, ensuring compliance with both local Hong Kong regulations and international sustainability standards (e.g., GRI, CDP, TCFD). Support transparency in sustainability performance and provide data for regulatory and investor reporting.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with teams in operations, supply chain, finance, and marketing to integrate sustainability data into business processes. Collaborate on projects that improve sustainability performance across the organization.
• Insights & Recommendations: Provide actionable insights and data-driven recommendations to improve operational efficiency and reduce environmental impact. Help develop sustainability strategies that align with corporate objectives.
• Automation & Data Tools: Use data analysis tools (Excel, Power BI, Tableau, Python, or R) to automate data collection and reporting processes, improving data accuracy and accessibility.
• Market and Regulatory Trends: Stay up to date on sustainability trends, environmental policies, and regulations in Hong Kong and globally. Ensure that the company’s sustainability practices align with local standards, including Hong Kong’s environmental regulations.

Qualifications:
• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science, Sustainability, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree is a plus).
• Experience: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on sustainability, ESG, or environmental data analysis.
• Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, R, or Python. Experience with database management or automation is a plus.
• Sustainability Knowledge: Familiarity with sustainability metrics, ESG reporting frameworks (e.g., GRI, CDP, TCFD), and environmental regulations, especially in the Hong Kong context.
• Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills to clearly present complex data and analysis to various stakeholders.
• Attention to Detail: High attention to detail with the ability to manage and interpret large, complex datasets and draw meaningful conclusions.
• Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities to identify trends and provide actionable solutions for sustainability challenges.

Preferred Skills:
• Knowledge of sustainability reporting and environmental regulations specific to Hong Kong.
• Experience with sustainability tools and platforms specific to the Asia-Pacific region.
• Familiarity with environmental modeling or advanced analytics techniques.
• A passion for sustainability and commitment to environmental stewardship.

Why Join Us:
• Impactful Work: Contribute to the company’s sustainability efforts, making a positive impact on both the environment and the community.
• Career Development: Be part of an organization that values professional growth, providing opportunities for skill development in data analytics and sustainability.
• Collaborative Environment: Work alongside a team of passionate and experienced professionals dedicated to driving sustainability.
• Competitive Compensation: Attractive salary and benefits package tailored to the Hong Kong market.

Cutting Edge Sustainability LinkedIn page

title: Service Operations Analyst
description:
About Ampd Energy

At Ampd Energy, we believe in making a zero-emission future for many industries a reality. Founded in 2014, Ampd Energy develops robust, versatile, advanced, compact, and connected battery energy storage systems (BESS) to replace the dirty, noisy, and hazardous diesel generators that power job sites in industries such as construction, civil works, mining, events, film, and utilities.

Ampd Energy is a mission and values-driven company with a diverse, high-performing global team supported by visionary customers who all want to make a difference. We are poised for significant expansion and seek dynamic, passionate team members to help propel our growth.

Ampd Energy is seeking a service operations analyst to plan, direct, execute, and manage the service operation processes within the company. You will be working under the service department, be based in Hong Kong, and will report to the Director of Service.

This role involves managing processes involving the customer deliveries, customer support, and inventory and quality management. This role requires a degree of flexibility to occasionally attend to the field engineers’ inquiries from different regions and time zones, even during out-of-office hours. Some of the projects will require collaboration with other departments such as supply chain, business development, product, and engineering. We are specifically looking for individuals who are organised, detail-oriented, dependable, and excited about being among the first in the world to work with new innovative technologies.

What you need:
- Bachelor’s degree in relevant studies.
- Minimum 2-3 years of experience in integrating and supporting operation processes.
- Experience in project management.
- Proficient in MS Office Applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint).
- Great documentation and report writing skills.
- Self-motivated, detailed oriented, organized.
- Good command of spoken and written English. Cantonese and Potunghua will be beneficial

What you will do:
- Manage all of service’s discussion channels and methods of communication.
- Maintain the department database such as service tickets, product specifications, and serial numbers.
- Create and maintain all service-related processes, workflow, standard operating procedures.
- Track all service projects progress and results.
- Collect and analyze data regarding the product reliability, usability, and performance.

title: Power Trader
extensions: ['12 days ago', 'HK$33K–HK$50K a month', 'No degree mentioned']
description: 職位名稱：電力交易員 (Power Trader) 崗位職責：1. 監控香港及粵港澳大灣區電力市場實時價格波動，制定即日/日前交易策略 2. 執行電力現貨、期貨及衍生工具交易，管理倉位風險 3. 分析電力供需數據（負荷預測、新能源出力、輸電阻塞等） 4. 開發量化交易模型，優化套戥與對沖方案 5. 對接發電廠、電網及大用戶，協商長期購售電協議（PPA） 6. 跟進碳交易政策（如香港碳市場試點），設計綠電交易組合 任職要求： 1. 碩士以上學歷2. 3年或以上能源交易經驗，熟悉香港及粵港澳大灣區電力市場規則（中電/港燈系統）3. 精通電力衍生工具定價（電力期貨、差價合約CFD）4. 熟練使用Python/MATLAB進行量化分析，掌握PLEXOS/PROPHET等專業工具 5. 英語流利（書面及口語），粵語為加分項 6. 抗壓能力強
